    style=3D'font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
    mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Source:<span
    style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>US Natural Resource Conservati=
on
    Service.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </div>
    <![if !mso]></td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <![endif]></v:textbox>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D308 height=3D346
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image001.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D12
alt=3D"Text Box: 2.1 Slope Development Suitability &#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;Slop=
e	Recommended Management&#13;&#10;	&#13;&#10;0-3%	Suitable for development,=
 may require drainage improvements&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;3-8%	Most desirable f=
or development, having the least restrictions&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;8-15%	Suit=
able for low-density development with consideration given to erosion contro=
l, runoff, and septic design&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;15-25%	Unsuitable for most =
development and septic systems; runoff and erosion problems likely; any con=
struction should be carefully managed&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;25%+	All construct=
ion should be avoided; careful land management is required.&#13;&#10;&#13;&=
#10;Source:  US Natural Resource Conservation Service.&#13;&#10;"
v:shapes=3D"_x0000_s2050"><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bid=
i-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Recent
changes in the state&#8217;s regulations now allow septic systems to be bui=
lt
on slopes up to 20%, opening up more upland areas to development (see
map).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Site preparation and
development on steeper slopes (15% or more) should be carefully managed
according to accepted management practices to minimize runoff and soil eros=
ion.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Development on slopes in excess of=
 25%
(estimated at 6,570 acres or 21%of the town&#8217;s total land area) should=
 be
avoided.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Development
in areas that are highly visible from public vantage points also should be
sited and designed to minimize visual impacts &#8211; by siting development
below prominent peaks and ridgelines, minimizing site clearing, screening
development from view, and using colors and materials that blend into the
surroundings.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>2.3<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Natural Resources=
<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
has a wealth of natural resources that contribute to a healthy and diverse
environment, and support local economic and community development.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The protection and sustainable use=
 of
the town&#8217;s natural resource base is necessary to maintain the quality=
 of
life for existing and future Northfield residents.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Many of the resources noted here a=
re
shown on accompanying maps.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Earth Resources</span></u></b=
><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p=
></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Geologic Features &amp; Hazar=
ds</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Northfield&#8217;s many quarries supported a thriving slate industry=
 in
the mid- to late 1800s, rescuing the community from economic decline follow=
ing
the relocation railroad operations.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>These quarries, which extend over several acres, are no longer
operational; however several quarries have been reopened in recent years
elsewhere in the state.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Other=
 rock
and mineral deposits are found locally, though not in commercial
quantities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Avid recreational
panners may find small amounts of placer gold in local streams.<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><!--[if supportFields]><s=
pan
lang=3DEN-CA style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-CA'><span
style=3D'mso-element:field-begin'></span><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span>SEQ CHAPTER \h \r 1</span><![endif]=
--><!--[if supportFields]><span
lang=3DEN-CA style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-CA'><span
style=3D'mso-element:field-end'></span></span><![endif]--><span style=3D'fo=
nt-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'>Geologic
hazards are minimal, though isolated rock falls and slides are common on st=
eep
or unstable slopes.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Regional =
earthquakes,
typically centered in the Adirondack Mountains or southern Quebec, occur wi=
th
enough frequency and strength that public infrastructure, buildings, and
utility systems should incorporate basic seismic standards for earthquake
resistance. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sand &amp; Gravel</span></b><=
span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Sand and
gravel deposits, located mainly along the Dog River and its tributaries, su=
pply
commercial extraction operations.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Based on soil surveys, it is estimated that there are nearly 4,500 a=
cres
of potential sand and gravel, though not all may be suitable for
extraction.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such operations s=
upply
much needed sand and gravel for road maintenance and construction; but if n=
ot
properly developed and managed, can result in unstable slopes and slides, a=
nd adversely
affect surface and groundwater quality, local roads, and neighboring
properties.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Phasing to limit
exposed areas, good management practices, and site reclamation can reduce s=
ome
of these impacts.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Agricultural Soils</span></b>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Farmland=
 still
in production locally is generally confined to the best agricultural soils =
in
town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield has around 4=
,500
acres of mapped &#8220;primary agricultural soils,&#8221; including soils of
federal and statewide importance (see map).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These soils are considered by the =
state
to be a critical natural resource for local agriculture and food production,
and as such are considered for protection in Act 250 review.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><u><o:p></o:p></u></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p><span style=3D'text-deco=
ration:
 none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Water Resources</span></u></b=
><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> <o:p></o:=
p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Groundwater</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Upland a=
reas,
and glacial sand and gravel deposits, serve as important aquifer recharge a=
reas
that replenish local groundwater supplies &#8211; including many private we=
lls
and the town&#8217;s well fields.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Most recharge areas have yet to be mapped, but the state has delinea=
ted
&#8220;source protection areas&#8221; (also known as wellhead protection ar=
eas)
to protect public water supplies (see map).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
delineated source protection area for the village water supply encompasses =
111
acres.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Potential sources of
contamination identified by the Northfield Water Department include road sa=
lt,
accidental spills, failed septic systems, fertilizer, runoff, pesticides,
herbicides, and chemicals.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The
Department has developed a source protection plan that was approved by the
state in 2002.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Extending sewer
service to this area would eliminate potential contamination from failed se=
ptic
systems.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Additional protectio=
n could
be implemented through local land use regulations. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Surface Waters</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfie=
ld has
approximately 100 acres of mapped surface waters.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Prominent surface waters in town i=
nclude
the Dog River and its tributaries (Cox Brook, Union Brook, Stony Brook, Fel=
chner
Brook, Bull Run, Sunny Brook and Robinson Brook) and small upland ponds,
including Felchner Pond, and a number of beaver ponds.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Surface waters also include upland
headwaters that feed local brooks and ponds.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Although these often do not show u=
p on
maps, headwaters are nevertheless important to sustain local water supplies=
 and
maintain water quality. A &#8220;surface water protection area&#8221; exten=
ding
along the Irish Hill ridge to Paine Mountain also has been delineated by the
state to protect the Berlin Pond that supplies water to Montpelier, and the
headwaters of the Dog River.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; <=
/span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Historically
the Dog River suffered the effects of damming, siltation, and pollution.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Today it is one of Vermont&#8217;s=
 top
wild trout streams, supporting natural populations of brown, rainbow, and b=
rook
trout.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The river and its major
tributaries are important cold-water fisheries that are particularly sensit=
ive
to changes in stream flow, temperature, and sediment loads.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Dog is also rated highly for i=
ts
scenic qualities and for recreational boating below the Nantanna Mill dam.<=
span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield Falls on the Dog River,=
 which
once supplied power for mills in Northfield Falls, is a locally significant,
scenic cascade.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></=
span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Surface
water quality is generally good.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Most waters in town are rated &#8220;Class B&#8221; by the state &#8=
211;
indicating that they will support local fisheries and are generally suitable
for recreation, and drinking with treatment.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Within a designated &#8220;mixing =
zone&#8221;
on the Dog River, extending downstream from the wastewater treatment plant
outflow, uses are more limited.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>This stretch of the river has been classified as &#8220;impaired&#82=
21;
by the state because of high concentrations of copper and toxics generated =
from
local industry.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Planned treat=
ment
plant improvements are expected to eliminate this source of pollution.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Other
threats to water quality include failed septic systems, stormwater runoff, =
and
sedimentation from construction sites, roads, and other impervious
surfaces.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These can be reduced
through the use of surface water setbacks, undisturbed buffer zones, and the
application of best management practices for stormwater management and eros=
ion
control.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p><span style=3D'text-deco=
ration:
 none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Environmentally Sensitive Are=
as<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Environmentally
sensitive areas are distinct areas that serve important ecological and
environmental functions, and are particularly vulnerable to the adverse imp=
acts
of development or mismanagement.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Development of these areas should be avoided, or carefully managed w=
here
encroachments are unavoidable.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Wetlands</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Wetlands=
, once
thought to be mosquito-ridden wastelands, are now recognized to serve a num=
ber
of important ecological and environmental functions &#8211; including but n=
ot
limited to flood management, ground and surface water recharge and
filtration.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>They also provide
important wildlife habitat, and contribute to the diversity and beauty of t=
he
natural landscape.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
loss of wetlands through draining and development is an issue of state and
national concern; significant wetlands are now protected under both state a=
nd
federal regulations.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Wetlands
regulated by the state are identified on the Vermont Significant Wetland
Inventory (VSWI) map for the town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; <=
/span></span><!--[if supportFields]><span
lang=3DEN-CA style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-CA'><span
style=3D'mso-element:field-begin'></span><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span>SEQ CHAPTER \h \r 1</span><![endif]=
--><!--[if supportFields]><span
lang=3DEN-CA style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-CA'><span
style=3D'mso-element:field-end'></span></span><![endif]--><span style=3D'fo=
nt-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'>There
are no extensive mapped wetland areas in Northfield, however many smaller
wetlands are found throughout town, along the Dog River and its tributaries,
and in headwater areas.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Not a=
ll
wetlands appear on this map, however.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Site-specific information and delineations may be required for the
review of impacts associated with a particular development.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Protection is typically provided t=
hrough
the designation of buffer areas at least fifty feet in width, within which =
very
few activities are allowed.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;
</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
town is required, under state and local regulations, to notify the state
wetlands office whenever development is proposed within or adjacent to mapp=
ed
wetland areas.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>There are a few
cases on record of local wetlands being filled in violation of these
regulations.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town may als=
o opt,
through local regulations, to protect wetlands that do not trigger state
review. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Floodplains</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Local fl=
ood
plains, including those areas along the Dog River and its tributaries, which
have a chance of flooding once every one hundred years (the 100-year
floodplain), have been roughly identified on federal Flood Hazard Boundary =
Maps
(FHBMs) for the town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Property
owners within mapped flood hazard areas are eligible to purchase flood
insurance through the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP) as long as the
town regulates development within these areas as required under state and
federal programs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town is=
 also
required to notify the state when development is proposed within mapped flo=
od
plains.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Flooding,
including flash flooding after major storms, may also occur on land outside=
 of
mapped flood plains, including upland streams.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Stream setbacks, buffers, and stor=
mwater
management requirements under local regulations can help reduce flood hazar=
ds
in these areas.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Wildlife Habitat</span></b><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Habitat =
loss,
over-hunting, and environmental pollution led to the extinction of a number=
 of
wildlife species locally and statewide, including deer, turkey and beaver
populations.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Reforestation has
allowed for the re-establishment of core and seasonal habitat areas, and
connecting (travel) corridors along ridgelines, streams and wetlands, which
support diverse wildlife populations, including both game and non-game
species.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Habitat fragmentatio=
n and
loss, however, from land subdivision, clearing and human use, continue to
threaten wildlife populations in the path of development.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Critical wildlife habitat areas in=
 town
identified to date (see map), and considered in state regulatory proceedings
include:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<ul style=3D'margin-top:0in' type=3Dsquare>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l23 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
     mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Time=
s New Roman"'>Several
     large <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>deer wintering areas</b>
     (more than 5,000 acres), also referred to as &#8220;deer yards,&#8221;
     which are critical to the winter survival of local deer populations;<o=
:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l23 level1 lfo3;tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:=
normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Seasonal bear habita</span></b=
><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>t (roughly 4,800 acres) located
     mostly in remote upland areas, including the Northfield Range; and<o:p=
></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-list:l23 level1 lfo3;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-siz=
e:
     10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>A <b
     style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>rare plant community &#8211; </b=
>a
     species of fern<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> &#8211;</b>on=
 the
     slopes of Paine Mountain.<o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ul>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Many
other important wildlife areas may exist in town, but have not yet been
identified or mapped.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Often t=
hese
are identified on a project-by-project basis; however, a more comprehensive
inventory could be undertaken locally by trained volunteers through Keeping
Track<sup>&reg; &#8211;</sup> a Vermont-based nonprofit that provides commu=
nity
training in wildlife identification and tracking.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Wildlife habitat protection could =
also
be incorporated under local subdivision and zoning regulations.<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
mso-list:l37 level2 lfo4;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>2.4<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times =
New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;
</span></span></span></i></b><![endif]><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:nor=
mal'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bi=
di-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Cultural
Resources<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
residents have long taken an interest in the town&#8217;s historic
development.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Northfield
Historical Society was established to preserve and interpret local history =
for
present and future generations of Northfield residents.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Society maintains a collection=
 of
materials and artifacts in its new home &#8211; the historic Paine House (t=
he
former site of the American Legion).<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal=
'><u> <o:p></o:p></u></b></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p><span style=3D'text-deco=
ration:
 none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Traditional Settlement Patter=
ns<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield&#8217;s
traditional settlement pattern &#8211; of clustered villages linked by an
integrated transportation network, and surrounded by an open river valley a=
nd
forested uplands &#8211; has been well-established since the nineteenth
century.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield&#8217;s
villages were developed at a scale and density that is pedestrian friendly,
with clearly defined streetscapes and public spaces, prominent public
buildings, and a variety of goods, services and employment opportunities
&#8211; all within easy walking distance of residential neighborhoods.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>As
noted in the town history, the introduction of the automobile significantly
altered the town&#8217;s character, yet this traditional pattern of develop=
ment
remains largely intact.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>North=
field
has yet to suffer the effects of large-scale, auto-oriented commercial strip
development and low density sprawl that are plaguing other Vermont communit=
ies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Issues associated with traffic and
parking, and the effects these have on residential neighborhoods, are more
common locally.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Through the u=
se of
local subdivision and zoning regulations, and carefully delineated water and
sewer service areas, Northfield can promote types and patterns of growth th=
at
are consistent with its traditional character, and help preserve its local
identity. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></u></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:sha=

    <p class=3DMsoNormal><st1:place w:st=3D"on"><st1:PlaceName w:st=3D"on">=

e Covered Bridge [1974]&#13;&#10;Stony Brook Covered Bridge [1974]&#13;&#10=

v:shapes=3D"_x0000_s2051"><![endif]><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal=
'><u><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Historic Sites &amp; Structures<o:p></o:p></span></u></b=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
has a wealth of historic resources that includes hundreds of documented
historic sites and structures, and many others that have yet to be identifi=
ed
or catalogued.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A few of
Northfield&#8217;s most historic structures &#8211; including its five cove=
red bridges,
the Vermont Central Railroad Station, the Old Mill Building and the Mayo
Building &#8211; were accepted for listing on the National Register of Hist=
oric
Places back in the 1970s and early 1980s.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:sha=
pe id=3D"_x0000_s2052"
 type=3D"#_x0000_t202" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;text-align:left;
 margin-left:0;margin-top:104.15pt;width:216.8pt;height:234.8pt;z-index:-24;
 mso-position-horizontal:left' wrapcoords=3D"-75 -112 -75 21600 21675 21600=
 21675 -112 -75 -112"
 strokeweight=3D"1.25pt">
 <v:textbox>
  <![if !mso]>
  <table cellpadding=3D0 cellspacing=3D0 width=3D"100%">
   <tr>
    <td><![endif]>
    <div>
    <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'margin-left:9.0pt;text-ali=
gn:center'><b
    style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
    mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-ascii-font-family:"=
Bookman Old Style";
    mso-hansi-font-family:"Bookman Old Style";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symb=
ol-font-family:
    Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:W=
ingdings'>&#353;</span></span></b><b
    style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
    mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Bookman Old Style"'> </span></b>=
<st1:place
    w:st=3D"on"><st1:City w:st=3D"on"><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:norm=
al'><span
      style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
      mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Northfield</span></b></st1:Ci=
ty></st1:place><b
    style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
    mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times=
 New Roman"'>
    Historic Cemeteries</span></b><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>=
<span
    style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdin=

 <w:wrap type=3D"square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D295 height=3D319
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image003.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D12
alt=3D"Text Box: &#353; Northfield Historic Cemeteries&#8250;&#13;&#10;&#13=
;&#10;Public Cemeteries (subject to municipal regulations &amp; policies):&=
#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;Aldrich (West Hill)&#13;&#10;Elmwood (Cemetery Street)&#=
13;&#10;Four Corners (Devils Washbowl)&#13;&#10;Loomis (Poor&#8217;s Road)&=
#13;&#10;Mount Hope (South Main Street)]&#13;&#10;Richardson (Norwich Unive=
rsity)&#13;&#10;Robinson (Robinson Road)&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;Private Cemeter=
ies:&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;Calvary Catholic Cemetery (Doyon Road)&#13;&#10;Old=
 Catholic Cemetery (King Street)&#13;&#10;Northfield Falls (Northfield Fall=
s)&#13;&#10;Norwich Cemetery (Norwich University)&#13;&#10;"
v:shapes=3D"_x0000_s2052"><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bid=
i-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>A more
comprehensive historic sites and structures survey for Northfield, conducte=
d by
the state in 1980-81, identified six separate historic districts, with 342
contributing structures (Table 2.2), and 79 other historic structures locat=
ed
throughout town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A structure
generally must be at least fifty years old, and retain its historic integri=
ty,
to be eligible for listing on state and national registers.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Most structures identified to date=
 are
historic homes, but also included several school houses, many of
Northfield&#8217;s public buildings, the Vermont Central Railroad engine ho=
use,
the Nantanna Woolen Mills complex, the Brown Public Library, and the Vine S=
treet
and Town Highway 57 bridges.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>=
At the
time the Northfield survey was conducted, many of these structures were in =
good
to excellent condition.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span=
><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Not
included on the initial survey were potential archaeological sites, includi=
ng
quarry and mill sites along the Dog River; town cemeteries which are an
important historic resource, and other types of historic structures such as
barns and outbuildings, that have yet to be identified or surveyed, but may
also contribute to the town&#8217;s cultural heritage.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield&#8217;s
six historic districts, and many of the historic structures listed on the s=
tate
inventory may be eligible for listing on the National Register of Historic
Places, and should be considered for nomination.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition to conferring state and
national recognition of historic significance, listed properties are eligib=
le
for limited state and federal financial assistance, including historic
preservation grants and rehabilitation investment tax credits. <o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Listing,
however, offers very limited protection from demolition or alteration &#821=
1;
potential impacts of development on listed properties are considered only f=
or
projects that are subject to federal or state review (e.g., Act 250).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Act 250 may also trigger an initia=
l site
assessment to determine if buried archaeological resources are present.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town could consider adopting
historic and/or design review regulations under zoning to further protect t=
he
character of individual historic landmarks or designated historic districts=
.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'mso-special-character:line-=
break;
page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Additional state assistance is available for historic
properties within designated downtowns under Vermont&#8217;s Downtown Progr=
am (see
Chapter 5), and for preservation projects conducted by &#8220;Certified Loc=
al
Governments (CLGs).&#8221;<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Northfield could apply for CLG status, which extends federal and sta=
te
preservation partnerships to the local level.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>CLGs are eligible for additional f=
ederal
and state preservation grants and technical assistance, and may participate
directly in the nomination of historic properties for listing.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In order to become a CLG, the town=
 would
need to:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l48 level1=
 lfo5;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Adopt and
enforce local legislation for the designation and protection of historic
properties;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l48 level1=
 lfo5;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Establish =
an
historic preservation review commission to review development within design=
ated
historic districts;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l48 level1=
 lfo5;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Maintain a
system for surveying and inventorying historic properties;<o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l48 level1=
 lfo5;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Provide for
public participation in local historic preservation programs, including
community-wide information and education; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l48 level1 lfo5;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>With
assistance from the state, meet responsibilities under the National Historic
Preservation Act. <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-=
bidi-font-style:
normal'><o:p></o:p></i></b></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:no=
rmal'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:l=
ine'><br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></i></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>2.5.<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Natural &amp; Cultural
Resource Goals, Policies &amp; Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<h5 style=3D'mso-pagination:none;tab-stops:-1.0in .5in'><span style=3D'font=
-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold;
mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Goals<o:p></o:p></span></h5>

<p class=3DMsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<div style=3D'mso-element:para-border-div;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-alt=
:solid windowtext .5pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-f=
ont-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-alt=
:solid windowtext .5pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-f=
ont-style:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>To identify, protect and pres=
erve
important natural and historic features of Northfield&#8217;s landscape, wh=
ich
help define the community&#8217;s unique identity and sense of place; and<o=
:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-alt=
:solid windowtext .5pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-f=
ont-style:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i><=
/p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-alt=
:solid windowtext .5pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-f=
ont-style:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>To maintain and improve the
quality of Northfield&#8217;s air, water, wildlife and land resources.</spa=
n></i><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-alt=
:solid windowtext .5pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'><span style=3D'font-si=
ze:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Policies</span></i></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Development
should be:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Carefully
managed on slopes of 15-25% to minimize surface water runoff and erosion, a=
nd
prohibited on slopes of 25% or more;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>2)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sited to a=
void
prominent ridgelines and hilltops, as viewed from public vantage points; <o=
:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>3)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Carefully
sited, designed and managed in upland areas (e.g., over 1800 ft) to avoid s=
teep
slopes and shallow soils, and adverse impacts to headwaters, groundwater
recharge areas, and scenic views from public vantage points;<o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>4)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sited and
carefully managed to avoid the fragmentation and degradation of critical
wildlife habitat, including core habitat areas and connecting corridors,<o:=
p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>5)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sited to
avoid, to the extent feasible, primary agricultural soils, which should be
protected for current and future agricultural use;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>6)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Setback
sufficiently and buffered from surface waters and wetlands as needed to pro=
tect
water quality, critical riparian habitat, and cold water fisheries (e.g., 50
foot minimum),<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>7)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sited to a=
void
and/or minimize impacts to designated source and surface water protection a=
reas
that supply community or municipal water systems<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>8)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sited to a=
void
flood hazard areas to the extent feasible, or where necessary, be designed =
to
minimize flood damage and the loss of life and property;<o:p></o:p></span><=
/p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>9)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sited and
designed to be consistent with Northfield&#8217;s historic settlement patte=
rn,
including traditional densities and scales of development, local street
networks, and streetscapes;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l15 level1 l=
fo6;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>10)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&=
nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Compatible
with Northfield&#8217;s historic architectural styles,<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.3in;
mso-list:l15 level1 lfo6;tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>11)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times =
New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Designed to
minimize adverse impacts to Northfield&#8217;s historic sites and structure=
s.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l19 level1 l=
fo7;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Continue to
inventory, catalogue and map Northfield&#8217;s natural and historic featur=
es
[Historical Society, Planning and/or Conservation Commission].<o:p></o:p></=
span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l19 level1 l=
fo7;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>2)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Update loc=
al land
use regulations as needed to adequately protect Northfield&#8217;s natural =
and
historic resources.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Consider =
the
adoption of conservation, historic and/or design review overlay districts, =
for
natural and open space protection, and for the adaptive reuse of historic
structures. [Planning Commission, Selectmen, Trustees].<o:p></o:p></span></=
p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l19 level1 l=
fo7;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>3)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Consider
nominating one or more of Northfield&#8217;s Historic Districts to the Nati=
onal
Register of Historic Places [Historical Society]<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l19 level1 l=
fo7;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>4)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Consider
application for Downtown and/or Certified Local Government designation to
access additional resources and financial assistance for historic preservat=
ion
[Selectmen, Trustees].<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.3in;mso-list:l19 level1 l=
fo7;
tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>5)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Seek finan=
cing
as needed for the redevelopment of the town&#8217;s historic properties,
including Northfield&#8217;s historic public buildings [Selectmen, Trustees,
Historical Society].<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.3in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.3in;
mso-list:l19 level1 lfo7;tab-stops:list .3in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>6)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Seek finan=
cing
as needed to conserve significant natural areas or features, through the
purchase of land or interests in land (e.g., conservation easements,
development rights).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>[Selectm=
en,
Trustees, Planning Commission, and/or Conservation Commission]. <o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;line-height:110%;mso-pagin=
ation:
widow-orphan;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in .5in .75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in=
 1.75in 2.0in 2.25in 2.5in 2.75in 3.0in 3.25in 3.5in 3.75in 4.0in 4.25in 4.=
5in 4.75in 5.0in 5.25in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;line-height:110%;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
font-variant:small-caps;text-transform:uppercase;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><=
br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoTitle><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0=
pt;
text-transform:uppercase'>Chapter 3.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Population<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>3.1<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Overview<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
composition and fluctuation of a community&#8217;s population can have a
significant influence on a number of issues of public concern.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Generally, rapid population change=
 can
stress community services, result in environmental degradation, create or l=
imit
economic opportunity, and/or impact housing conditions and values.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The presence of large age cohort &=
#8211;
such as a large retirement or student population &#8211; can place special =
demands
on community services.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This c=
hapter
examines population trends and characteristics in Northfield, and identifies
those likely to affect future conditions in the community.<o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>3.2<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Historic
Trends</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.=
0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Since
its settlement in 1785, Northfield&#8217;s population change varied from th=
at
of most Vermont communities (see Figure 3.1).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town&#8217;s 19<sup>th</sup> c=
entury
population peaked around 1860 &#8211; at which time Northfield was the
state&#8217;s fourth most populous community.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The local decline of the railroad,=
 which
began in the 1850s, the American Civil War, and subsequent westward migrati=
on,
preceded a period of population decline.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&n=
bsp;
</span>For much of Vermont, that period of decline lasted through the 1950s=
.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The trend reversed itself much ear=
lier
in Northfield, however, which experienced relatively steady population grow=
th
since 1890.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><!--[if gte vml 1]><o:wrapblock><v:shapetype
  id=3D"_x0000_t75" coordsize=3D"21600,21600" o:spt=3D"75" o:preferrelative=

  </v:formulas>
  <v:path o:extrusionok=3D"f" gradientshapeok=3D"t" o:connecttype=3D"rect"/>
  <o:lock v:ext=3D"edit" aspectratio=3D"t"/>

 </o:OLEObject>
 <![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><span style=3D'mso-ignore:vglayout'>

   <td width=3D17 height=3D0></td>
  </tr>

   <td><img width=3D611 height=3D429 src=3D"TownPlan_files/image005.gif" v:=

  </tr>
 </table>
 </span><![endif]><!--[if gte vml 1]></o:wrapblock><![endif]--><br
style=3D'mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=3DALL>
<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in .5in'><span style=3D'font-=
size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h5>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in .5in'><span style=3D'font-=
size:
14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'>3.3<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Recent Trends<o:p=
></o:p></span></h5>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In recent years, Northfield&#8217;s population growth has
been relatively slow.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>During =
the
1980s and 1990s, the town&#8217;s population increased a total of 3.2% for =
each
decade &#8211; an average annual rate of 0.3% since 1980.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town&#8217;s rate of population
growth has been lower than that of Washington County as a whole.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Over the past 10 years communities
located in the western portion of the county have seen rapid population gro=
wth.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>All of Northfield&#8217;s neighboring municipalities
experienced higher rates of population growth during the previous two decad=
es,
although Roxbury&#8217;s rate of increase slowed considerably during the 19=
90s.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This is even true with Williamstown
that, despite being located some distance from regional population and
employment centers, exhibited a significantly higher rate of population gro=
wth
since 1980.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A comparison of
population change in surrounding towns is provided in Table 3.1. <o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

  <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dright style=3D'text-align:right'><span
  style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman"'>24.3%<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

t:

e:11.0pt;

ew Roman"'>Source:
  U.S. Census.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-fo=
nt-weight:
  normal'><sup><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>1</span></sup><=
/b><span
  style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Northfield Village&#8217;s 2000
  population, as reported by the U.S. Census, included students residing on=
 the
  Norwich University Campus, although the campus is located outside the Vil=
lage
  boundaries.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The on-campus s=
tudent
  population &#8211; 1,198 residents &#8211; was excluded from the Village
  population in this table. Student residents were included in both the 1990
  and 2000 population figures for the town, which includes all village
  residents.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
