<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><b style=3D'mso-=
bidi-font-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>3.4
Components of Population Change<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>According to the University of Vermont&#8217;s Center for
Rural Studies, 66% of Northfield&#8217;s population growth during the 1970s=
 was
due to in-migration (people moving to town).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>During the 1980s, however, all
population growth was attributable to natural increase (the number of local
births minus local deaths), with more people leaving town during the decade
than moving in.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>This trend was reversed over the past decade, as 79% of =
the
population increase during the 1990s was attributable to net migration.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The remaining 21% of the population
growth during the 1990s was due to natural increase (see Figure 3.2).<o:p><=
/o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><!--[if gte vml =
1]><v:shape
 id=3D"_x0000_s2056" type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;
 text-align:left;margin-left:0;margin-top:64.8pt;width:297.4pt;height:159.6=
pt;
 z-index:7;mso-wrap-distance-left:14.4pt;mso-wrap-distance-top:7.2pt;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:14.4pt;mso-position-horizontal:left;
 mso-position-horizontal-relative:margin;mso-position-vertical-relative:pag=
e'
 o:allowincell=3D"f" stroked=3D"t" strokeweight=3D"1.5pt">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image006.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest" anchorx=3D"margin" anchory=3D"pag=
e"/>
 <w:anchorlock/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2056" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873282">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D401 height=3D217
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image007.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D19 style=3D'margi=
n-top:10px;
margin-bottom:0px;margin-bottom:0px;margin-top:10px' v:shapes=3D"_x0000_s20=
56"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-f=
ont-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>3.5
Population Projections<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>In additio=
n to
past trends, future population changes should be considered to avoid
unanticipated burdens to the community. In 2001, the Central Vermont Region=
al
Planning Commission contracted with Economic &amp; Policy Research Inc. (ER=
PI)
of Williston to prepare economic and demographic forecasts for towns in the
region through 2020.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Accordin=
g to
the ERPI forecast, Northfield&#8217;s population is expected to increase by=
 an
estimated 221 people by 2010, an average annual rate of growth of 0.4%.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This is among the slowest projecte=
d rate
of population increase in Washington County.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Figure 3.3 displays the ERPI forec=
ast,
to the year 2020.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It should be
noted, however, that since the EPRI projections were developed it was annou=
nced
that a major new employer<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>&#8=
211;
the National Center for the Study of Cyber-Terrorism and Cyber-Crime &#8211;
would locate in Northfield (see Chapter 5).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The potential influx of new reside=
nts
would likely result in a higher rate of growth than what was projected.<o:p=
></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Should
population projections for the town and Washington County come to pass,
Northfield will comprise 9.8% of the county&#8217;s population in 2010, a
slight reduction from the 10% of the county population it comprised in 2000=
.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>That percentage is projected to co=
ntinue
to decline, with the town expected to comprise 9.5% of the county&#8217;s
population in 2020. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=3D"_x0000_=
s2054"
 type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;text-align:left;
 margin-left:0;margin-top:-64.15pt;width:282.4pt;height:168.25pt;z-index:5;
 mso-wrap-distance-left:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-top:7.2pt;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;
 mso-position-horizontal:left' stroked=3D"t" strokeweight=3D"1.25pt">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image008.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest"/>
 <w:anchorlock/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2054" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873283">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D381 height=3D229
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image009.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D14 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2054"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>3.6 Population
Characteristics<o:p></o:p></span></i></h4>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield&#8217;s
population, following state and national trends, has aged over the past
decade.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The number of childre=
n (17
years of age or less) has declined.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>The greatest increase occurred in the 35-64 year old &#8220;baby
boomer&#8221; category.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Norwi=
ch
University&#8217;s student population inflates the number of 18-34 year old
residents in town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Omitting t=
he
student population residing in on-campus dormitories considerably reduces t=
he
population of 18-34 year olds.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </spa=
n>It
also shows that this age group declined significantly during the 1990s.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Unless substantial in-migration oc=
curs,
the town&#8217;s school-aged population is likely to continue to decline in
coming years.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The composition=
 of
the population in 1990 and 2000 is presented in Figure 3.4. <o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Time=
s New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-farea=
st-language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DLevel1 style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0=
in;
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;mso-outline-level:body-text;mso-list:none;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=3D"_x0000_=
s2055"
 type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;text-align:left;
 margin-left:0;margin-top:74pt;width:297.4pt;height:159.6pt;z-index:6;
 mso-wrap-distance-left:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-top:7.2pt;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;
 mso-position-horizontal:left;mso-position-vertical-relative:page' stroked=
=3D"t"
 strokeweight=3D"1.25pt">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image010.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest" anchory=3D"page"/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2055" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873284">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D401 height=3D216
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image011.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D14 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2055"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In addition to age distribution, the U.S. Census provide=
s a
range of current information regarding the characteristics of town and vill=
age
population.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A statistical pro=
file
of Northfield&#8217;s 2000 population is provided in Table 3.2, which revea=
ls
several similarities &#8211; and some noteworthy differences &#8211; between
town and village population and that of the county and state.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>In
many respects, the town&#8217;s population characteristics in 2000 were qui=
te
similar to the county&#8217;s and state&#8217;s population.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Similarities exist in:<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l14 level1=
 lfo8;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Median fam=
ily
income<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3Da style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l49 level1=
 lfo9;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Ethnic
diversity<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3Da style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l49 level1=
 lfo9;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Formal
education, and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3Da style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25=
in;
mso-list:l49 level1 lfo9;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Family siz=
e<i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></i></span></p>

<p class=3Da style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><span style=3D'fo=
nt-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DLevel1 style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0=
in;
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;mso-outline-level:body-text;mso-list:none;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>In several
other respects, the characteristics of the town&#8217;s population vary
considerably from those of the county and state.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This is due to the relatively large
number of Norwich students, which makes the town population younger, less
wealthy (as indicated by per capita income), disproportionately male, and l=
ess
impoverished.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It appears, how=
ever,
that if the student population is removed from mix, the town&#8217;s popula=
tion
remains similar to the county&#8217;s and state&#8217;s in most respects.<o=
:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DLevel1 style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0=
in;
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;mso-outline-level:body-text;mso-list:none;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DLevel1 style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0=
in;
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;mso-outline-level:body-text;mso-list:none;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=3D"_x0000_=
s2057"
 type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;text-align:left;

 mso-wrap-distance-right:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;

 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image012.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square"/>
 <w:anchorlock/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2057" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873285">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D415 height=3D214
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image013.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D14 style=3D'margi=
n-top:14px;
margin-bottom:10px;margin-bottom:10px;margin-top:14px' v:shapes=3D"_x0000_s=
2057"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Census figures also provide comparative information betw=
een
the town&#8217;s population and that portion of the town&#8217;s population
residing in the village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Some=
what
surprisingly, the village population contains both a greater percentage of
elderly residents and a greater percentage of school aged children.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The elderly population includes
residents of senior care facilities, and the relatively large school aged
population may indicate the presence of younger families, although the
percentage of 18-34 year olds is low relative to the town outside of the
village (see Figure 3.5). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DLevel1 style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0=
in;
mso-pagination:widow-orphan;mso-outline-level:body-text;mso-list:none;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";

</span>

  <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dright style=3D'text-align:right'><span
  style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman"'>2.5%<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style=3D'mso-yfti-irow:27;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;page-break-inside:avoid;
  height:20.15pt'>
  <td width=3D606 colspan=3D5 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:454.5pt;border:so=
lid windowtext 1.0pt;
  background:white;padding:0in 4.05pt 0in 4.05pt;height:20.15pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:10.0pt;
  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Source: U.S. Ce=
nsus
  data.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><sup><span style=3D'fon=
t-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>1</span>=
</sup><span
  style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman"'>Population
  figures for the Village include 1,198 Norwich University students residin=
g on-campus,
  although the University&#8217;s student housing is located outside the
  Village. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3Da style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify'><span style=3D'fo=
nt-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'>The
village population also is less wealthy, as indicated by median family inco=
me
(which excludes students) and poverty rates.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>While the percentage of village fa=
milies
living below the poverty level (6.5%) is slightly higher than the county
(5.5%), it is considerably higher than that of the town (3.2%, which includ=
es
village residents).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Further, =
the
percentage of village individuals living in poverty (12.1%) is significantly
higher than in the town (6.7%), county (8.0%), or state (9.4%).<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bi=
di-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>3.7<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Special Populatio=
ns<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-=
font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p><span style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span><=
/o:p></span></h4>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-f=
ont-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>The 2000 Census identified=
 two
significant populations living in group-quarters in Northfield.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The village had an institutionaliz=
ed
population of 114, which includes residents of local senior care
facilities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The number of res=
idents
in such facilities has remained stable since 1990.<o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>An
additional 1,198 students were reported to be living on the campus of Norwi=
ch University
in 2000.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>According to univers=
ity
officials, that number had increased to nearly 1,400 in 2002.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>An additional 300 students live
off-campus.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These commuter
students, which include dependents of university employees, reside througho=
ut
central Vermont, although many are presumed to live in private apartments
within Northfield.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
university does not anticipate a substantial change in the number of commut=
er
students over the next 5 to 10 years.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>The number of students residing on campus, however, may increase by =
as
many as 250 during the same period.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Such an increase in enrollment would be accommodated through the
construction of new on-campus housing, although plans for construction have=
 not
been developed.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The universit=
y is
presently preparing a facilities plan that will address student housing.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>That plan, which is being prepared=
 with
the involvement of municipal officials, is expected to be completed in 2003=
.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>As
stated previously, a relatively high percentage of the village population is
living below the poverty level (232 individuals).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A relatively high number of elderly
residents also reside in the Village (378 individuals over 65 years of age),
although the percentage that is elderly is skewed by the student
population.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>An additional 296
elderly residents reside outside of the village.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>In
2000 there were, in addition to the 114 residents of residential care
facilities, 564 elderly residents (aged 65 and over) living in the town.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Of these, nearly half (274) were
disabled.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>An additional 659
non-elderly residents were identified by the Census as disabled.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>When the university student popula=
tion
residing on-campus is deleted from the total population, over 20% of the to=
wn
population and over 25% of the village population is identified as disabled=
.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Disabilities reported may include a
range of physical or mental conditions that limit an individual&#8217;s abi=
lity
to perform one or more normal daily activities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This is significantly higher than =
the
percentage of the county population (17.3%) or state population (16.1%) tha=
t is
disabled.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is important to =
note,
however, that 68.6% of the disabled population aged 21 to 64 (510 residents)
are presently employed.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This =
is a
slightly higher percentage than for the county (64.1%) or state (60.0%), wh=
ich
may indicate that the local disabled population does not have an uncommonly
high demand for special services relative to the county as a whole.<b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><o:p></o:p></i></b></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:no=
rmal'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:l=
ine'><br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></i></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>3.8
<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Population (Growth
Management) Goals, Policies &amp; Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:none;tab-stops:-1.0in .5in'>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Goal<o:p></o:p></span></h5>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<div style=3D'mso-element:para-border-div;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-a=
lt:solid windowtext .5pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'><i><span style=3D'font=
-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>To accommodate a reasonable r=
ate
of growth which maintains a diverse year-round population and does not
overburden existing or planned facilities and services. <o:p></o:p></span><=
/i></p>

</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Policies</span></i></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-list:l26 level=
1 lfo10;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Accommodat=
e a
level of development over the next 10 years that results in a minimum avera=
ge
annual rate of population growth of 0.4% (approximately 22 new residents
annually) within the town and village, in addition to potential enrollment
increases at Norwich University.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;
text-indent:0in;tab-stops:.5in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-list:l26 level=
1 lfo10;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'>=
<span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>2)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Encourage,
through land use and housing goals and policies, a socially and economically
diverse population.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>To the ex=
tent
possible, such goals and policies should promote a greater increase in
year-round population (in excess of the projected 0.4% annual rate of incre=
ase)
and associated development within Northfield Village and delineated municip=
al
sewer and water service areas. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l27 level1 lfo11;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Track annu=
al
permit data, and monitor population and housing estimates prepared annually=
 by
the Vermont Department of Health, to identify correlations between housing =
development
and population growth [Planning Commission, Staff].<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'fo=
nt-size:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'>2)<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Periodically review and update
enrollment projections in relation to population growth and housing develop=
ment
[School Board, Planning Commission].<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l26 level1 lfo10;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>3)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Prepare a
Capital Improvement Program (CIP), including an annually updated and adopted
capital budget, to identify and schedule needed capital improvements based =
on
anticipated population growth and available financing<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>[Selectmen and Trustees, in associ=
ation
with the Planning Commission and School Board]. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l26 level1 lfo10;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>4)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Exercise
statutory party status in Act 250 and other state regulatory proceedings as
appropriate, to ensure that town and village growth needs and limitations a=
re
adequately addressed in accordance with municipal plan policies and recomme=
ndations
[Planning Commission, Selectmen].<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
font-variant:small-caps;text-transform:uppercase;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><=

clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoTitle><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0=
pt;
text-transform:uppercase'>Chapter 4.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Housing<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoTitle style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:1=
1.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:uppercase;font-weight:normal'><o:p=
>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoSubtitle style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-fo=
nt-style:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nb=
sp;</o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=3DMsoSubtitle style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-fo=
nt-style:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4.1<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Overview<o:p></o:=
p></span></i></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>A
safe, decent place to live is one of life&#8217;s basic necessities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>For this reason, a main goal of lo=
cal
planning is to ensure sound, safe, and affordable housing for all Northfield
residents, now and in the future. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
is fortunate to have a variety of housing that offers new and existing
residents a broad range of rental and ownership opportunities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A diverse housing stock supports a
diverse community &#8211; providing homes for families and individuals in
various stages of life, who work in town, support community organizations, =
and
contribute to the local economy.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Housing represents a major investment for many local residents.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>For some, however, household incom=
es may
not be keeping pace with rising housing costs.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Housing
also represents an important community investment.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Well-constructed and maintained ho=
mes,
including many of the historic homes that line our village streets, contrib=
ute
much to Northfield&#8217;s tax base, historic character, and sense of
place.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>On the other hand, hou=
sing
that is poorly sited, constructed or maintained can destroy natural resourc=
es,
overburden public services, reduce property values, increase household
operating expenses, and result in unsafe housing conditions and a general s=
ense
of decline.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Planning to meet
community housing needs requires a more careful look at local households, a=
nd
related housing and market trends.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4.2<span style=3D'mso-=
tab-count:
1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Household Trends &amp; Characteristics<o=
:p></o:p></span></i></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>How
the local population is arranged into households &#8211; which include all
related and/or unrelated individuals living together under one roof &#8211;
affects the demand for housing, employment, public services and facilities.=
<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The number of households in Northf=
ield
has increased over the years as the town&#8217;s population has grown, and
households have gotten smaller.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </sp=
an>A
snapshot of Northfield&#8217;s changing households is provided in Table 4.1=
.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>According
to the U.S. Census, in 2000 there were 1,819 households in Northfield, 45% =
of
which resided in Northfield Village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>During the 1990s, 137 new households were established in town &#8211;
over half (52%) of which were located in the village.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The number of households in town h=
as
been increasing more rapidly than its population, contributing to the local
demand for housing.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<div align=3Dcenter>

  height:9.6pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'text-align:center'><b

  mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>8.1%<o:p></o:p></span=

</div>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Following
national and statewide trends, household size has been declining in recent
decades &#8211; the result of an aging population, families having fewer
children, the breakup of extended family households, and a relative increas=
e in
single parent and non-family households.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&n=
bsp;
</span>Northfield&#8217;s average household size, as noted above, decreased
from 2.61 persons per household in 1990 to 2.46 persons in 2000.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Town wide, households were slightly
larger than state and county averages, and included a higher percentage of
households with children and single parent families.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Village households are typically s=
maller
&#8211; in 2000 averaging 2.34 persons per household.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This is likely due to the higher
percentage of non-family, single parent, and elderly households in the vill=
age
(Table 4.2). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</table>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Non-family
households in Northfield include Norwich University students who live
independently, off-campus.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As=
 noted
in the previous chapter, there are currently around 300 students living
off-campus.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Campus housing,
consisting of dormitories and barracks (group quarters), serve another 1,400
students.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is not known how=
 many
commuter students reside in town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>There is concern, however, that off-campus student housing &#8211;
created in part through the conversion of single family homes into rental
apartments &#8211; is affecting the condition of the housing stock, the
character of some village neighborhoods, and the local rental market.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The university considers the manag=
ement
of off-campus housing by private landlords as contributing to this situatio=
n,
but will be evaluating the need to provide additional on-campus housing as =
part
of its facilities planning process to be completed in 2003. <o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>It
is anticipated that locally household size will continue to decline, and th=
at
the shift toward more nontraditional households will also continue &#8211;
resulting in increases in non-family, &#8220;empty nester,&#8221; and elder=
ly
households.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>New household arr=
angements
may in turn increase local demand for accessory apartments, low maintenance
rental units, and smaller starter or retirement homes, to complement the
town&#8217;s growing stock of single family dwellings.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></h1>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4.3<span style=3D'mso-=
tab-count:
1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Housing Trends<o:p></o:p></span></i></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Historically,
as a local commercial and transportation hub, Northfield experienced much m=
ore
residential development than did its neighbors.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This held true until 1970, when th=
e rate
of housing growth in surrounding communities began to surpass that of the
town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As reported in 2000,
Northfield housing units numbered 1,958, representing 7% of the county&#821=
7;s
total housing stock.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Of these=
, 857
units (43.7%) were located in Northfield Village.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Of its immediate neighbors, only W=
arren
had more housing units &#8211; the result of explosive ski area-related
condominium and seasonal home development in the 1970s and 1980s (Table 4.3=
). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Time=
s New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-farea=
st-language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'mso-special-character:line-break;page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

 style=3D'margin-left:15.0pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 1=
.5pt 0in 1.5pt'>

 <tr style=3D'mso-yfti-irow:2;height:12.35pt'>
  <td width=3D117 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:87.5pt;border-top:none;border=

  padding:0in 1.5pt 0in 1.5pt;height:12.35pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman";
  color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=3D67 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:50.5pt;border-top:none;border-=
left:none;
  border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windo=
wtext .75pt;

n></p>

  height:12.35pt'>
  <td width=3D588 colspan=3D8 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:441.1pt;border:so=
lid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in 1.5pt 0in 1.5pt;height:12.35pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman";
  color:black'>Source:<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>U.S. C=
ensus.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
rate of housing development in Northfield has slowed significantly in past
decades &#8211; declining from an average of nearly 40 units per year in the
1970s, to 17 units per year in 1980s, down to less than 10 units per year in
the 1990s.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>During the last de=
cade,
Northfield&#8217;s rate of housing growth was the slowest in the area, and
roughly half that of the state.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </sp=
an>The
rate of housing growth in the village during the same period (7.7%) actually
exceeded that of the town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Interestingly, 2000 Census data suggest that this was due to the
construction of new single-family homes in the village, rather than the
conversion of existing single-family dwellings into multi-family units.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Given
current population projections through 2010 (~220 persons), average househo=
ld size
(2.46 persons per household), and low vacancy rates, it is anticipated that
Northfield will need 90 to 100 additional housing units by the year 2010
&#8211; representing little or no increase in the current rate of housing
development.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such projections=
, however,
cannot anticipate major changes in the housing market that may result from =
such
events as the gain or loss of a large employer, an influx of off-campus col=
lege
students, or other regional development that could increase the local demand
for housing. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'>4.4<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Housing Character=
istics<o:p></o:p></span></i></h4>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>A
summary of local housing characteristics is presented in Table 4.4.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2000, housing in both the town =
and
village consisted largely of owner-occupied, single family dwellings, thoug=
h as
expected, the village had a much higher percentage of multi-family and rent=
al
units.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Seasonal homes made up=
 a
very small portion of both town and village housing. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Local
vacancy rates for both sale and rental units have decreased over the past d=
ecade,
reflecting an increasingly tight housing market.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The reported 2000 local vacancy ra=
te for
sale units was only 1.3% &#8211;compared to statewide rate of 1.4%.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The vacancy rate for rental units =
was
3.4%, compared with a 4.2% rate for the state. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'mso-special-character:line-=
break;
page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
8.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

g<o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
8.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Much
of Northfield&#8217;s housing stock, including many of its historic village
homes, was built prior to 1939.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Older homes, while lending to the town&#8217;s historic character, a=
re often
more difficult and expensive to heat and maintain because of their age, size
and condition.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>No comprehensi=
ve
survey of local housing conditions has been conducted recently, but 2000 Ce=
nsus
data suggest that all but a few homes in town have been upgraded over the y=
ears
to include complete plumbing and kitchen facilities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Overcrowding is also not a problem
&#8211; less than 1% of units house more than one occupant per room.<o:p></=
o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
general condition of housing varies in the community &#8211; there is conce=
rn
that the conversion of older single-family homes into rental units is leadi=
ng
to their deterioration.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This
perceived trend could be more clearly evaluated and documented through a lo=
cal
housing survey. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-f=
ont-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Special Ne=
eds
Housing <o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Group Housing</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As noted=
, Norwich
University provides on-campus housing for 1,400 resident students.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The need for additional student ho=
using
will be addressed in the university&#8217;s 2003 facility plan, which is un=
der
development.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>There
are also licensed Level III residential care facilities in town &#8211; the
Four Seasons Care Home on South Main Street, Mayo Assisted Living on Water
Street, and the Mayo DeLary House on Vine Street.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Mayo Nursing Home on Richardson Av=
enue
offers an advanced level of long-term care.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These homes have a combined capaci=
ty to
serve up to 113 elderly men and women and adults with disabilities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Services, provided on a fixed fee =
basis,
include room and board, help with personal care, 24-hour non-medical
supervision, and limited nursing assistance.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Subsidized Housing</span></b>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>There are
currently 84 publicly subsidized housing units in Northfield, which provide
housing for low-income families and individuals (Table 4.5).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These units, located in six housing
developments, represent 4.3% of the town&#8217;s housing stock, and 5.0% of=
 the
county&#8217;s total supply of subsidized housing.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The three largest developments &#8=
211;
accounting for 72 of the 84 units &#8211; are managed by the Vermont State
Housing Authority.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The others=
 are
managed locally.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>One-bedroom =
units
specifically designated for elderly housing make up 38% of the total.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Only 3 of the 84 units (3.6%) are
three-bedroom units, which can house larger families.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<div align=3Dcenter>

</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Mobile Home Parks<o:p></o:p><=
/span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Six
of Washington County&#8217;s 27 mobile home parks are located in Northfield=
, which
include 18% of the county&#8217;s total inventory of leased mobile home lots
(Table 4.6).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>All but one of
Northfield&#8217;s parks were established prior to 1980, and all are privat=
ely
owned and managed.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Monthly lot
rents in 2001 were generally less than state ($229) and county ($258) media=
ns,
and varied in part based on the number and types of services provided.<o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;

 <tr style=3D'mso-yfti-irow:10;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=3D638 colspan=3D8 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:6.65in;border:sol=
id windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:s=
olid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:10.0pt;
  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Source:<span
  style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:=
normal'>2001
  Registry of Mobile Home Parks, </i>VT Dept. of Housing &amp; Community Af=
fairs
  [2/02].<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Mobile
home parks are viewed by the state as a means of providing safe, sanitary, =
and
affordable housing for low and moderate-income households.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Given the age of many parks, the r=
ate of
their sale and conversion to other uses, the lack of new park development, =
and
limited vacancy rates statewide, retaining and improving mobile home parks =
have
become matters of state policy.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </sp=
an>As
such, a number of laws and programs have been adopted in recent years to
improve and protect existing parks.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>This includes the &#8220;Mobile Home Park Law (Act 252)&#8221; which
requires that park residents be given notice of any intent by the owners to
sell the park.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Residents then=
 have
a limited period of time to consider purchasing the park, with some assista=
nce
from the state, either through a resident cooperative or a nonprofit housing
agency.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>There
is concern that mobile home parks in the vicinity of the town&#8217;s well
field, which are not hooked up to the municipal wastewater system, may poll=
ute
the public water supply.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A li=
ne
extension to serve these parks is under consideration as part of the propos=
ed
upgrade of the municipal wastewater treatment system.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4.5<span style=3D'mso-=
tab-count:
1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Housing Affordability<o:p></o:p></span><=
/i></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-famil=
y:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>When
viewed statewide, housing in Northfield is less expensive than housing
elsewhere in Vermont (Table 4.7).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>According to U.S. Census data, the median reported value for a house=
 in
Northfield in 2000 was $96,700 &#8211; 94% of the county median, and only 8=
7%
of the statewide median.<a style=3D'mso-footnote-id:ftn1' href=3D"#_ftn1"
name=3D"_ftnref1" title=3D""><span class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-special-character:footnote'><![if !supportFootnotes]><span
class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi=
-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'>[1]</span></sup></span><![endif]></span></span></s=
up></span></a><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Housing in the village generally w=
as
relatively even more affordable.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Reported monthly mortgage and owner costs for local homeowners were =
also
generally lower than county and state medians &#8211; however local monthly
rental rates were higher than the county median.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<table class=3DMsoNormalTable border=3D1 cellspacing=3D0 cellpadding=3D0 wi=

dowtext'>

</table>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Relative
affordability, however, is also determined by household income.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Between 1989 and 1999, Northfield&=
#8217;s
median household income increased by more than 40%, however median mortgage
costs increased by 56.7% over the same period, suggesting that local incomes
were not keeping up with rising homeowner costs. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>According
to federal and state definitions currently in use, housing is
&#8220;affordable&#8221; when households at or below the median income level
spend no more than 30% of their gross household income on housing costs.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2000, 27% of Northfield homeown=
ers,
and 33% of local renters, were paying in excess of 30% of their incomes on
housing.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This indicates that
housing may not be so affordable for at least a portion of the local popula=
tion
&#8211; and particularly for local renters who generally have lower househo=
ld
incomes.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>An
affordability analysis based on federal and state 2000 income and housing c=
ost
data (summarized in Table 4.8) suggests that local housing is currently
affordable for all but Northfield&#8217;s very low-income households.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This analysis, however, assumes
household incomes based on two wage earners.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>One-wage earner, single parent, and
elderly households on fixed incomes may also be expected to have difficulty
keeping up with rising housing costs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'mso-special-character:line-=
break;
page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

e:8.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman"'>Housing
  is defined as &quot;affordable&quot; when households with incomes at or b=
elow
  median income pay no more than 30% of their gross household income on hou=
sing
  costs; low income=3D80% median, very low income=3D50% median. <o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

  County income is the estimated median family income for Washington County=

  <td width=3D25 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:18.45pt;border:none;border-lef=
t:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-left-alt:solid black .75pt;padding:0in 1.5pt 0in 1.5pt;height:
  22.5pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dright style=3D'margin-left:6.75pt;text-align=
:right'><span
  style=3D'font-size:8.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>4)<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=3D613 colspan=3D6 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:459.45pt;border:n=

  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=

  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman"'>Median
  adjusted gross income, as reported by the VT Tax Dept. for Northfield in =
2000;
  doubled to estimate income from 2 wage earners.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style=3D'mso-yfti-irow:23;page-break-inside:avoid;height:13.5pt'>

  mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>5)<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=3D613 colspan=3D6 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:459.45pt;border:n=

  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=

  annual wage as reported by VDET for Northfield in 2000; doubled to estima=
te
  household income from 2 wage earners.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style=3D'mso-yfti-irow:24;page-break-inside:avoid;height:12.35pt'>
  <td width=3D25 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:18.45pt;border:none;border-lef=

  </td>
  <td width=3D613 colspan=3D6 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:459.45pt;border:n=

  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=

  amount assumes financing for 30 years, at a fixed rate of 7%.<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style=3D'mso-yfti-irow:25;page-break-inside:avoid;height:23.85pt'>

:right'><span

  mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>7)<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=3D613 colspan=3D6 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:459.45pt;border:n=

  padding:0in 1.5pt 0in 1.5pt;height:23.85pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=

>[VT

ew Roman"'>The

  2000 US Census.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
