</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>It
appears that homeownership may be financially out of reach for some low- and
moderate- income Northfield residents.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbs=
p;
</span>Home purchase programs are available for income-qualified local
residents through the Central Vermont Community Land Trust and the Vermont =
Housing
Finance Agency.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>County reside=
nts
with household incomes less than $57,100 (or $66,600 for a family of three =
or
more) currently may qualify for low interest Vermont Housing Finance Agency
mortgages to finance existing homes selling for up to $152,000, or new homes
valued up to $179,000.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These
figures are updated annually in relation to reported incomes and rising hou=
sing
costs.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso=
-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi=
-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'pag=
e-break-before:
always'>
</span></i>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>4.6<span style=3D'mso-=
tab-count:
1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Regulating Housing<o:p></o:p></span></i>=
</h1>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Vermont
municipalities may regulate residential development, but cannot exclude cer=
tain
types of housing, such as mobile homes and mobile home parks, from the
community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Towns are also req=
uired
to address local housing needs, and to provide for their share of regional
housing, as determined for Washington County by the Central Vermont Regional
Planning Commission.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><o=
:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Under
&#8220;equal treatment of housing&#8221; provisions in state law, the town =
must
also allow for mobile homes, other types of manufactured housing, and small
group homes (serving six or fewer residents), in the same manner that
conventional single family homes are allowed.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>&#8220;Accessory apartments&#8221;=
 to
single-family dwellings, to house elderly or disabled family members, must =
also
be allowed subject to review under local zoning.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>To encourage the development of mo=
re
affordable housing statewide, state law was amended recently to allow
municipalities to grant density bonuses of up to 50% for affordable housing
within planned residential or planned unit developments.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield&#8217;s current zoning =
allows
for planned residential and planned unit development to encourage a variety=
 of
housing types and clustered residential development, but does not allow for=
 any
increases in density. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>At
present, it appears that Northfield is generally providing for its fair sha=
re
of local and regional housing; however, local regulations should be reviewe=
d to
make sure they are consistent with state housing definitions and requiremen=
ts,
and to allow for the development of affordable housing as needed in areas
supported by infrastructure which are close to services.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Local regulations could also be up=
dated
to define and better address affordable and elderly housing, accessory
apartments, group homes, residential care facilities, mixed use buildings (=
that
could include apartments), potential inconsistencies with state statute reg=
arding
the current prohibition of mobile home parks, and the conversion of single
family to multi-family dwellings.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>4.7<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Housing Goals, Po=
licies
&amp; Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Goal</span></i></b><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b><=
/p>

<div style=3D'mso-element:para-border-div;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-alt=
:solid windowtext .5pt;
padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-f=
ont-style:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>To ensure the availability of
safe and affordable housing for all Northfield residents</span></i><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Policies</span></i></b><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p=
></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l7 level1 lfo12;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Housing sh=
ould
be encouraged to meet the needs of a diversity of social and income groups,
particularly for Northfield residents of low and moderate income.<o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l7 level1 lfo12;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>2)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>New and
rehabilitated housing should be safe, sanitary, and located conveniently to
employment and commercial centers. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l7 level1 lfo12;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>3)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Housing
development should be coordinated with the provision of necessary supporting
public infrastructure, services, and facilities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l7 level1 lfo12;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>4)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sites for
manufactured and multi-family housing should be made available in locations
similar to those used for conventional single-family dwellings.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Higher densities of residential
development should be considered in areas served by municipal water and
wastewater facilities.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l7 level1 lfo12;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>5)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Accessory
apartments should be allowed within or attached to single-family dwellings =
to
provide affordable housing, supervision and care for elderly or disabled
relatives.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";

     Staff]<o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ul>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l11 level1 lfo13;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>10)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times =
New Roman"'>&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Review hou=
sing
recommendations, and any regional fair share allocations, included in the n=
ext
Central Vermont Regional Plan or related regional housing studies, for
consideration within local housing programs and/or regulations as appropria=
te
[Planning Commission, Staff]. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;line-height:110%;mso-pagin=
ation:
widow-orphan;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in .25in .5in .75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in=
 1.75in 2.0in 2.25in 2.5in 2.75in 3.0in 3.25in 3.5in 3.75in 4.0in 4.25in 4.=
5in 4.75in 5.0in 5.25in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;line-height:110%;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'text-align:center;tab-stops:6.=
5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Chapter
5.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Local Economy</span></b><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
 6.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in .5in .75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.=
5in 1.75in 2.0in 2.25in 2.5in 2.75in 3.0in 3.25in 3.5in 3.75in 4.0in 4.25in=
 4.5in 4.75in 5.0in 5.25in'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bi=
di-font-size:
10.0pt'>5.1 <span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Overv=
iew<o:p></o:p></span></i></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>The Town and Village of
Northfield<a style=3D'mso-footnote-id:ftn2' href=3D"#_ftn2" name=3D"_ftnref=
2" title=3D""><span
class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi=
-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-special-character:footnote'><![if !su=
pportFootnotes]><span
class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi=
-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'>[2]</span></sup></span><![endif]></span></span></s=
up></span></a>
have long supported an economic climate in which local residents have acces=
s to
meaningful employment within the community.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Not only does a healthy economy di=
rectly
benefit Northfield citizens, economic development can benefit the community=
 by
expanding the municipal property tax base.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>=
&nbsp;
</span>Although taxes to support local schools are no longer based solely u=
pon
a community&#8217;s property wealth, municipal services and facilities are
still funded through locally levied property taxes.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This section addresses economic tr=
ends
and conditions, and provides background regarding the community&#8217;s ong=
oing
economic development efforts.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>5.2<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Economic
Trends<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bid=
i-font-size:
10.0pt'>Labor Force<o:p></o:p></span></u></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Northfield&=
#8217;s
resident labor force is composed of residents aged 16 and above, excluding
full-time students, retirees, and others who choose not to work for wages or
salary.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Of the 4,825
Northfield residents aged 16 and over, 3,100, or 61.2%, are in the labor fo=
rce.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This relatively low percentage (co=
mpared
to 69.3% for the state and 70.5% for the county) is largely attributable to
Norwich University&#8217;s student</span><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>
</span><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-famil=
y:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-weight:
bold'>population.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Nearly half
(48.5%) of the town&#8217;s labor force resides in Northfield Village.<o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>According to the 2000 U.S. Census, approximately 35% of
local workers are employed in <b>education, health, and social services</b>
&#8211; a much larger percentage than that of the county and state.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This includes local residents empl=
oyed
by Norwich University &#8211; the town&#8217;s largest single employer.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A breakdown of the labor force, by
industrial sector, is presented in Figure 5.1.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoFooter style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 405.0=
pt right 6.0in'><!--[if gte vml 1]><o:wrapblock><v:shape
  id=3D"_x0000_s2059" type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:=
0;

.35pt;
  z-index:10' o:allowincell=3D"f" stroked=3D"t" strokeweight=3D"1.25pt">
  <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image014.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
  <w:wrap type=3D"topAndBottom"/>
  <w:anchorlock/>
 </v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.She=
et.8"

 </o:OLEObject>

   <td><img width=3D536 height=3D319 src=3D"TownPlan_files/image015.gif" v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2059"></td>
  </tr>
 </table>
 </span><![endif]><!--[if gte vml 1]></o:wrapblock><![endif]--><br
style=3D'mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=3DALL>
<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoFooter style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>As of July 2002, the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:no=
rmal'>unemployment
rate</b> in Northfield was 4.7%, compared with a rate of 4.0% for the count=
y as
a whole.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Unlike the county, w=
hich
has seen its unemployment rate increase from the previous year,
Northfield&#8217;s rate of unemployment remains unchanged from July 2001.<o=
:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in .25in .75in 1.25in 1.7=
5in 2.25in 2.75in 3.25in 3.75in 4.25in 4.75in 5.25in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal'><o:=
p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h1>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in .25in .75in 1.25in 1.7=
5in 2.25in 2.75in 3.25in 3.75in 4.25in 4.75in 5.25in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Journey to work</span>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal'> da=
ta,
compiled by the U.S. Census, identify where local residents are employed.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Although these 2000 census data ha=
ve not
yet been published, 1990 data indicated that 46.9% of the resident labor fo=
rce
(1,228 workers) was employed in town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>In addition, 14.6% of local residents worked in Montpelier, 7.6% in
Barre City or Barre Town, and 4.4% in Berlin.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>An additional 29% of all workers
employed in town commuted into Northfield from other places. <o:p></o:p></s=
pan></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in .25in .75in 1.25in 1.7=
5in 2.25in 2.75in 3.25in 3.75in 4.25in 4.75in 5.25in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:normal'>Des=
pite
the lack of more recent journey to work data, it is noteworthy that the ave=
rage
commute to work for town residents in 1990 was 18.9 minutes. In 2000, the
average commute had increased only slightly to 21.1 minutes.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This likely indicates that a signi=
ficant
percentage of local residents are still employed within the community.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such a conclusion is supported by
employment data reported for the town.<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in .25in .75in 1.25in 1.7=
5in 2.25in 2.75in 3.25in 3.75in 4.25in 4.75in 5.25in'><u><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p><span style=3D'te=
xt-decoration:
 none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></h1>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bid=
i-font-size:
10.0pt'>Covered Employment<o:p></o:p></span></u></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
 .5in 1.0in 1.5in 2.0in 2.5in 3.0in 3.5in 4.0in 4.5in 5.0in 5.5in 6.0in 6.5=
in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=

       <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'text-align:center'><b

       <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'text-align:center'><st1=

       <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'text-align:center'><span

       </td>
       <td width=3D82 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:61.5pt;border-top:none;bo=

       mso-border-top-alt:solid black .75pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid black=

       mso-border-alt:solid black .75pt;padding:0in 1.5pt 0in 1.5pt;height:
       12.35pt'>
       <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'text-align:center'><span
       style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=

k><![endif]--><br
style=3D'mso-ignore:vglayout' clear=3DALL>
<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>In contrast to the resident labor
force, which is composed of all workers <i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:nor=
mal'>living</i>
in Northfield, regardless of their place of work, <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'>covered employment</b><a style=3D'mso-footnote-id:ftn3' href=3D"#_f=
tn3"
name=3D"_ftnref3" title=3D""><span class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-special-character:footnote'><![if !supportFootnotes]><span
class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi=
-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'>[3]</span></sup></span><![endif]></span></span></s=
up></span></a>
is composed of jobs located within the town regardless of the employees&#82=
17;
place of residence.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Covered e=
mployment
increased by 9.6% between 1990 and 2000, reflecting the creation of 154 new
jobs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This represents an aver=
age
annual rate of job growth of slightly less than 1% &#8211; lower than the
annual average of 1.5% experienced by both Washington County and the state
during the same period.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Total
covered employment, by type of industry, is provided in Table 5.1.<o:p></o:=
p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Most job growth during the 1990s occurred in the <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>manufacturing, services,</b> and<b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> government sectors.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Government, </b>which accounts for=
 over
14% of Northfield&#8217;s total covered employment, experienced job growth
primarily in local educational services.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&n=
bsp;
</span><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Manufacturing,</b> which in=
 2000
accounted for nearly 16% of total employment, saw a sharp increase between =
1990
and 1995, although the number of manufacturing jobs declined after 1995.<o:=
p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The broad services category accounts for nearly 39% of
covered employment in the community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>This category includes a variety of small businesses.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition, Norwich University, t=
he
mainstay of the local economy, currently employs approximately 500 workers.=
 <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bid=
i-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-style:
normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Local Employers<o:p></o:p></span></u></h=
5>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The total number of reporting units<a style=3D'mso-footn=
ote-id:
ftn4' href=3D"#_ftn4" name=3D"_ftnref4" title=3D""><span class=3DMsoFootnot=
eReference><sup><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-special-character:footnote'><![if !supportFootnotes]><span
class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi=
-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'>[4]</span></sup></span><![endif]></span></span></s=
up></span></a>,
or <i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>employers</i>, also increased sl=
ightly
in Northfield from 128 reporting units in 1990 (120 of which were private
businesses) to 133 reporting units in 2000 (125 of which were in the private
sector). Most of the increase in new businesses was in <b style=3D'mso-bidi=
-font-weight:
normal'>services</b> (+10) and <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>who=
lesale
trade</b> (+2), with <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>retail</b> (-=
5), <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>manufacturing</b> (-4), <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>construction</b> (-1) and <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>transportation &amp; public utilities=
 </b>(-1)
all showing a decline in the number of businesses operating in the
community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The breakdown of a=
ll
employers, by sector, is presented in Figure 5.2.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5=
in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>While </spa=
n><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Norwich University</span><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> is the most important local
service industry employer in terms of total jobs, there are an additional 46
service sector employers in town, making this the most dominant employer
category.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Retail trade was se=
cond,
with 27 businesses in 2000, and construction was third with 22 businesses
primarily composed of tradesmen and small builders.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Each of the other categories was c=
omposed
of fewer than 10 reporting units.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id=3D"_x0000_s=
2058"
 type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;text-align:left;

 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image017.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest"/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=

</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D389 height=3D244
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image018.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D14 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2058"><![endif]><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id=3D"_x0000_s2060" type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;
 text-align:left;margin-left:0;margin-top:151.2pt;width:278.85pt;height:188=
pt;
 z-index:11;mso-wrap-distance-left:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-top:7.2pt;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;
 mso-position-horizontal:left;mso-position-horizontal-relative:margin;

 strokeweight=3D"1.25pt">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image019.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest" anchorx=3D"margin" anchory=3D"pag=
e"/>
 <w:anchorlock/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2060" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873289">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D376 height=3D254
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image020.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D14 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2060"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Average Wages<o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The relatively slow rate of job growth in the community =
is
coupled with lower than <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>average wa=
ges </b>compared
with the county and state.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In=
 2000,
the average wage for covered workers employed in Northfield was $24,015, or
$11.55/hour.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This wage is les=
s than
85% of the county and state average.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Average annual wages for the town, county and state in 2000 are comp=
ared
in Figure 5.3.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>There is widespread concern in Vermont regarding the abi=
lity
of full-time workers to earn an income sufficient to meet a family&#8217;s
basic needs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This is commonly
referred to as a &#8220;<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>livable wa=
ge</b>.&#8221;<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Vermont Joint Fiscal Office has
identified that an annual livable wage for a family of four with two working
parents in 2000 ranged from $11.34/hour per earner ($47,163) to $16.12/hour=
 per
earner ($67,065), depending upon access to employer-assisted health insuran=
ce.
The range of a livable hourly wage for a single parent with one child ranged
from<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>$15.28 to $21.48, while =
that
for a single person was $9.57 to $12.38. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Based upon the Joint Fiscal Office&#8217;s study, many l=
ocal
wage earners may be earning less than a livable wage, especially if workers
lack adequate health insurance coverage.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&n=
bsp;
</span>Focusing economic development activities on the creation of well-pay=
ing
jobs is especially critical in Northfield to ensure that local residents can
meet their basic needs.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in .25in'><u><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Sales Recei=
pts<o:p></o:p></span></u></h5>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In addition to employment and wages, another useful meas=
ure
of economic activity may be found in the gross retail sales, restaurant
receipts, and commercial accommodation rentals generated by Northfield
businesses.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Figure 5.4 shows =
total <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>sales receipts</b> reported by local
businesses for each fiscal year between 1996 and 2001.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Gross receipts include gross retail
sales, including those that are not subject to the Vermont sales tax (e.g.,
groceries, medicine).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></=
o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><!=
--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id=3D"_x0000_s2063" type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;

t;

 mso-wrap-distance-right:10.8pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;
 mso-position-horizontal:left' o:allowincell=3D"f" stroked=3D"t" strokeweig=
ht=3D"1.25pt">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image021.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest"/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2063" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873290">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D422 height=3D255
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image022.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D14 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2063"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Total gross <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>ret=
ail
sales</b> receipts, adjusted for inflation, increased a total of 4.1% betwe=
en
1996 and 2001.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In comparison,=
 gross
retail sales within the county increased nearly 38% during the same period.=
<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 1996 retail sales in Northfield
accounted for 3.3% of total retail sales in the county.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2001, Northfield&#8217;s share =
of the
county total decreased to 2.5%, indicating a potential weakness of the local
retail sector relative to the county.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>This is further indicated by the decline in retail establishments in=
 the
community during the 1990s. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In addition to retail sales, the Vermont Department of T=
axes
also reports total <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>lodging and
restaurant sales</b> that are subject to the state&#8217;s rooms and meals =
tax.
Total annual rooms and meals receipts for 1996 through 2001 are presented i=
n Figure
5.5. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Rooms and meals receipts experienced annual fluctuations
similar to retail sales, although the net increase since 1996 was 7.2%
(adjusted for inflation).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As =
was
the case with retail sales receipts, gross sales over the six-year period
actually peaked in 1999 and have declined nearly to 1996 levels. <o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><b><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>5.3<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Economic
Outlook<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 5.5in=

 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image023.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square"/>

</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=

style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield&#8217;s history is marked by economic diversi=
ty
and innovation in responding to changing circumstances and opportunities.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In recent years, however, economic
activity in the community has lagged behind that of the county and state.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Although a high percentage of town
residents are able to work within the community, average wages remain below=
 the
county and state average and the rate of local job creation and business gr=
owth
have remained relatively flat.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0=

idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Although a
detailed economic forecast was not prepared as part of this planning effort,
there are several reasons for optimism regarding the community&#8217;s econ=
omic
outlook that may offset many of the concerns discussed above.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The causes for optimism include se=
veral
recent developments that combine to create a much stronger environment for
community and economic development efforts than existed a short time ago.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These include:<o:p></o:p></span></=

in'><span

idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Any one of these projects is an enhancement to the
community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Taken together, th=
ey
serve to increase the community&#8217;s capacity to accommodate additional
growth in a well planned manner, attract new visitors to the community, exp=
and
cultural and recreational opportunities for residents and visitors, and rei=
nforce
the village as the community&#8217;s commercial, civic and residential
center.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This can form the
foundation for future economic and community development efforts.<o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;

</span></u></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Community &amp; Economic
Development</span></u></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-siz=
e:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5=
in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Effective
community and economic development programs typically require the cooperati=
on
of a variety of groups and individuals.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nb=
sp;
</span>Most important is that municipal officials and local businesses
communicate openly and work together in a cooperative and coordinated fashi=
on.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The following are key participants=
 in a
coordinated economic and community development program.<o:p></o:p></span></=
p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:6.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l22 level1=
 lfo17;
tab-stops:-1.0in 0in list .25in left 6.5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><sp=
an
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Town &amp; Village Government</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>, primarily the office of the Municipal Manager, who has
been designated as the community&#8217;s economic development point
person.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition, the join=
t town
and village planning commission has assumed a more active role in long range
planning and community development.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:6.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l22 level1=
 lfo17;
tab-stops:-1.0in 0in list .25in left 6.5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Northfield Business &amp; Professional
Association</b><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>(NBPA), whose
members are volunteers representing a variety of local business and communi=
ty
interests.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>After a period of
limited activity, the NBPA has undergone a resurgence in recent years and is
actively working to promote a better economic climate in the community.<o:p=
></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l22 level1 lfo17;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in list .25in left 6.5in=
'><![if !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><sp=
an
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Norwich University</span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>,
which, as the largest local employer, plays a unique role in the community.=
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in 0in 6.5in=
'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In addition to local groups and individuals, several
regional organizations are available to provide a range of assistance to lo=
cal
officials and businesses.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such
organizations include the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Central
Vermont Economic Development Corporation</b>, which assists with business
recruitment, financing, and marketing, and the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-we=
ight:
normal'>Central Vermont Revolving Loan Fund</b>,<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-w=
eight:
normal'> </b>which provides financial and technical assistance to local
businesses that employ persons of low and moderate income.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Other programs available to local
businesses include various tax credits and property tax abatement (from the
education portion of the property tax bill) may be available through the <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Vermont Economic Progress Council</b>
(VEPC), which grants incentives to eligible businesses. <o:p></o:p></span><=
/p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>To date, no
comprehensive economic development strategy or program has been developed in
Northfield.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>However, the incr=
eased
emphasis on the community&#8217;s economic needs has prompted local officia=
ls
to assume a more active role regarding business development.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Typically, successful economic and
community development programs are tailored to meet the unique needs and
opportunities present in a particular community.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In the case of Northfield, opportu=
nities
that should be the focus of future economic development efforts include:<o:=
p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l35 level1 =
lfo18;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font=

ily:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&=
sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Enhancing =
the
vitality of the downtown<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l35 level1 =
lfo18;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font=

ily:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&=

style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Reuse and
development of existing industrial and commercial facilities<o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l35 level1 =
lfo18;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font=

11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-fam=
ily:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&=

style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Continued
support for Norwich University<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in;
mso-list:l35 level1 lfo18;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in list .25in'><![if !support=
Lists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Targeted
infrastructure development to maintain capacity for new development<o:p></o=
:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3D1Paragraph style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:0in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Downtown
Vitality<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield&#8217;s earliest years were marked by the
creation of four district villages.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>With the establishment of the woolen mill industry and subsequent
opening of the railroad, Northfield (formerly &#8220;Factory&#8221;) Village
emerged as the town&#8217;s dominant commercial, industrial, civic, and
residential center.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>At the co=
re of
the Village is the downtown area, which centers around the historic common.=
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The economic vitality of the downtown is an issue of
widespread public concern.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Th=
e need
to focus the community&#8217;s attention and resources on the downtown was =
one
of five top priorities identified during the January 2002 Northfield Commun=
ity
Visit sponsored by the Vermont Council on Rural Development.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Participants at the community visi=
t emphasized
the need for a downtown planning committee and called attention to the <i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Northfield Village Downtown Plan</i>,
prepared by the Cavendish Partnership in 1997.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0=
in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>The 1997
downtown plan specifically addressed many of the concerns and suggestions
raised during the community visit.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Based upon background analysis, community input and market study, the
downtown plan set forth a conceptual master plan that included several
initiatives for improving the vitality and economic climate in the
downtown.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Key recommendations
include:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in;
mso-list:l17 level1 lfo19;tab-stops:-1.0in list .25in'><![if !supportLists]=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Enhancemen=
t of
physical connections between the downtown and the University through the
creation of walking/bicycle path along Dog River, and associated improvemen=
ts
to a University owned &#8220;eco-park.&#8221;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in;
tab-stops:-1.0in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in;
mso-list:l17 level1 lfo19;tab-stops:-1.0in list .25in'><![if !supportLists]=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Better
organization and more efficient use of the Northfield Business Park, with t=
he
objective of better integrating this area with the historic downtown.<o:p><=
/o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in;
tab-stops:-1.0in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in;

10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Consolidat=
ion
of municipal offices into a new municipal center, with the secondary benefi=
t of
transferring existing municipal space to a private user.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2002, the Vermont legislature a=
greed
to transfer ownership of the old Armory &#8211; located in the core of the
downtown &#8211; to the municipality for public use<b style=3D'mso-bidi-fon=
t-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>. <o:p></o:p></i></b></span=
