<span style=3D'font-size:9.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'=
><br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText2 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>In addition, several a=
ppointed
positions depend upon volunteers to fulfill municipal functions, including a
five-member planning commission, five-member board of adjustment and
seven-member recreation board.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p><span
 style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Cost of Government</span></u></b><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-=
bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:=
p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id=3D"_x0000_s2069" type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;
 text-align:left;margin-left:0;margin-top:42.5pt;width:300.5pt;height:169.9=
5pt;
 z-index:20;mso-wrap-distance-top:7.2pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;
 mso-position-horizontal:left' o:allowincell=3D"f" stroked=3D"t">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image030.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest"/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2069" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873293">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D403 height=3D228
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image031.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D12 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2069"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>An issue of particular concern to Northfield residents is
the local property tax burden.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Partly as a result of Act 60, local education taxes in Northfield are
comparable to those of surrounding communities (see Chapter 8).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Municipal taxes, however, are generally higher than in
neighboring communities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This=
 is
largely due to the fact that Northfield residents enjoy a higher level of
municipal service than most neighboring towns.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such services include a full-time =
police
department, recreation facilities (including a municipal swimming pool),
staffed fire and ambulance services, and exceptional road maintenance.<o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>When compared with municipalities that share similarities
with Northfield &#8211; such as a comparable population, the presence of a
large tax-exempt property owner, an incorporated village, and/or a community
that provides a broad range of public services and facilities &#8211; local=
 tax
rates are not unusual.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A comp=
arison
of effective tax rates in selected municipalities that share with Northfield
one or more of the aforementioned features is presented in Figure 7.1.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The effective tax rate is not, however, by itself an
accurate measure of local tax burden.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>When compared with the average tax burden on residential properties =
with
less than six acres (&#8220;R1&#8221; properties, the most common residenti=
al
property in the state), Northfield&#8217;s relative burden is not out of li=
ne
with comparable communities (see Figure 7.2). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id=3D"_x0000_s2070" type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;
 text-align:left;margin-left:0;margin-top:18.8pt;width:299.1pt;height:171.1=
5pt;
 z-index:21;mso-wrap-distance-top:7.2pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;
 mso-position-horizontal:left' stroked=3D"t">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image032.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest"/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"
 ShapeID=3D"_x0000_s2070" DrawAspect=3D"Content" ObjectID=3D"_1197873295">
</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D401 height=3D230
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image033.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D12 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2070"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield&#8217;s tax rate is higher than those of neig=
hboring
communities because the Grand List includes a higher than average percentag=
e of
properties that are exempt by law from property taxes.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Maintaining the balance between the
obvious benefits of the university and the demand for services it places on=
 the
community will be an important component of the town&#8217;s ability to
continue providing quality services without overburdening local property
owners.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In addition, strategies aimed at promoting additional
economic development, especially the creation of new industrial facilities =
in
established industrial parks and the revitalization of the downtown (Chapte=
r 5)
should serve to expand the municipal grand list, thereby spreading the tax
burden among a greater number of taxpayers.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It should be noted, however, that =
few
Vermont communities have managed to &#8220;outgrow&#8221; a heavy tax
burden.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Development strategies
should be broadly focused on promoting activities that pay high wages and
enhance the local quality of life, in addition to expanding the tax base. <=
o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Another important strategy for financing public faciliti=
es
and services as efficiently as possible is generating alternative, non-tax
revenues.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town and villag=
e have
been aggressive in pursuing a range of grant programs from such sources as =
the
Vermont community development program, VTrans &#8220;enhancements&#8221;
program, VTrans local bridge program, Vermont municipal planning grant prog=
ram,
and other project-specific grant programs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>=
&nbsp;
</span>In addition, the community has demonstrated an ability to raise priv=
ate
funds to support worthwhile projects, such as the recent expansion of the B=
rown
Public Library that was supported, in part, with donations.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Continued focus on alternative rev=
enue
sources as was currently done successfully by the Gray Building Coalition w=
ill
continue to be an important local goal.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bi=
di-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Capital Bud=
get
&amp; Program</span></u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-fami=
ly:
"Times New Roman";font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></h5>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-f=
ont-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></h5>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-f=
ont-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal;font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Another strategy that =
the
town and village have used effectively to stabilize spending &#8211; and
therefore tax rates &#8211; has been capital budgeting and programming and =
the associated
use of reserve funds.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>By
anticipating the need for future capital projects, multiple purchases may be
coordinated, and funds set aside in reserve accounts, to equalize the burden
over several years.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This avoi=
ds
sharp fluctuations in local tax rates, allowing residents and businesses to
plan ahead with a greater degree of certainty.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition, the capital improveme=
nt
program is a necessary tool to have in place, should the community consider
enacting impact fees or require the phasing of large developments. </span><=
span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><o:p></o:p>=
</span></h5>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Village-Town Coordination</span></u=
></b><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The town and village have discussed the consolidation of
village and town governments as a means of improving efficiencies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Past proposals to merge the two ha=
ve
been defeated by the voters.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Providing, managing, and financing municipal services is an increasi=
ngly
complex and challenging task.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>Since
this trend is virtually certain to continue, it is necessary to raise the
question of whether Northfield Town and Village should continue to exist as
separate political entities.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>At their annual joint policy review meeting in the Fall =
of
each year, the Village Trustees and the Town Selectmen should review this
question and determine whether the timing is appropriate for a merger study=
 to
be undertaken.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>If a merger st=
udy is
undertaken and concludes that merger is advisable, the boards should present
the question to the voters for their consideration.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Regardless of whether the two governments completely
consolidate, they have made significant strides over the past two decades to
cooperate and coordinate the provision of services and facilities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Today, responsibility for emergency
services, recreation, municipal administration, planning and zoning, and ro=
ad
maintenance are shared.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 20=
02,
the two governments strengthened this record of cooperation by entering int=
o an
inter-local agreement regarding the management of the wastewater treatment
system capacity outside of the Village limits.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>7.3<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Emergency
Services</span></i></b><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Fire Department<o:p></o:p></span></=
u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The Northfield Fire Department is one of three emergency
response providers serving the entire community.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The department operates from the f=
ire
station in the village, located adjacent to the downtown on Wall Street.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This facility is adequate to meet
current and projected needs, although expansion may be needed if the fire
department were to share a facility with the ambulance service (see below).=
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In 2000, the department responded to 140 calls, including
grass fires, propone leaks, automobile accidents, and structural fires.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The number of calls was considerab=
ly
higher than the average of 99 calls per year experienced over the past five
years.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The department is a me=
mber
of the Capital Fire Mutual Aid system, which obligates the department to as=
sist
neighboring departments in responding to major fires in exchange for assist=
ance
in fighting major fires in Northfield. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The fire department is presently staffed by 20+ volunteer
firefighters, which is considered adequate to meet current needs.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Firefighters are paid for time spe=
nt
responding to calls and volunteer for training and administrative duties.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Operating costs are funded through=
 a
combination of town allocations ($49,690 budgeted in 2001), proceeds from t=
he
department&#8217;s fundraising efforts, including the popular annual duck r=
ace,
and state and federal grants.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Capital equipment is generally replaced on a ten-year
cycle.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In recent years, the
department has upgraded its self-contained breathing apparatus, replaced its
ladder truck, acquired a new pumper and thermal imaging camera, and improved
the fire station.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town has
established several reserve accounts to cover the cost of capital equipment
replacement, including vehicles, although no major expenditures are anticip=
ated
within the next five years. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Ambulance Service<o:p></o:p></span>=
</u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The Town of Northfield supports a fully equipped, full-t=
ime
volunteer ambulance service.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>=
In
addition to serving the town and village, the ambulance service also respon=
ds
to calls in Roxbury and parts of Berlin and Moretown.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The service is operated by a full-=
time
supervisor, part-time ambulance attendant, and 20+ volunteers with varying
levels of state certification as Emergency Medical Technicians (EMTs).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The service maintains two fully eq=
uipped
rescue vehicles, a rescue vehicle.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>They recently upgraded their rescue capacity with the acquisition of=
 a
&#8220;jaws of life&#8221; extraction tool.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The ambulance service presently op=
erates
out of space in the town garage.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In 2000 the service responded to 602 calls, including
emergency responses, non-emergency transports and stand-by service at local
events.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The ambulance service=
 is
also responsible for maintaining the local &#8220;E-911&#8221; emergency
response system (see below), and has incorporated the functions of the local
health officer.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Funding for t=
he
ambulance service comes from a combination of user fees, private fundraisin=
g,
and municipal allocations, with approximately 70% of operating costs being
covered by fees.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The town bud=
geted
$143,830 in 2001 for operating expenses.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&n=
bsp;
</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The most pressing capacity issue facing the service is l=
imited
daytime coverage due to a shortage of available volunteers.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>With regard to capital facilities,=
 a
reserve fund has been established to replace Rescue Unit 1 in the next five
years.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Other minor equipment =
needs
include new defibrillators, which are also budgeted in the town&#8217;s cap=
ital
improvement program.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o=
:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>An issue that has yet to be addressed is the need for a =
new
location from which the ambulance service can operate more efficiently and
effectively.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Space at the town
garage is limited, and conflicts exist between emergency response and
maintenance operations on the same site.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&n=
bsp;
</span>The most likely site for a new ambulance location is a shared facili=
ty
with the fire department, which is possible with the expansion of the build=
ing
presently housing the fire department.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbs=
p;
</span>Plans for such an addition are only preliminary at this time.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>An important consideration is whet=
her
the ambulance and fire department should be co-located at an existing locat=
ion,
or whether the police department should also be located within a new public
safety facility housing all emergency service providers.<o:p></o:p></span><=
/p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Police Department<o:p></o:p></span>=
</u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Law enforcement services are provided by the Northfield
Police Department, a full-time, full service law enforcement agency serving=
 the
town and village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The departm=
ent is
staffed by a chief of police, six full- time officers, and occasionally
part-time officers.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>All offic=
ers
have received training at the Vermont Police Academy. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The department, which is served by an on-site dispatcher
during regular working hours and a state police dispatcher after hours and =
on
weekends, responds to an average of 1,840 calls per year. Annual operating
costs for the department were budgeted at $401,090 in 2001 &#8211; making t=
he
police department second only to the highway department in terms of total
annual cost to the municipality.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>It is difficult &#8211; if not impossible &#8211; to dra=
w a
correlation between criminal activity and police effectiveness.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Crime statistics appear to indicat=
e,
however, that Northfield is a relatively safe community and is getting
safer.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 1997, there were 50=
.5
&#8220;Part 1&#8221; crimes per thousand residents, and 93.3 &#8220;Part
2&#8221; crimes per thousand residents.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nb=
sp;
</span>Part 1 crimes include homicide, rape, aggravated assault, arson, and
larceny.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Part 2 crimes are of=
 a
relatively less serious nature, including forgery, vandalism and drug and
alcohol offenses.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2000, the
number of Part 1 crimes per thousand residents had decreased to 22.3, while=
 the
number of Part 2 crimes had reduced to 56 per thousand residents (see Figure
7.3). <span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span>This compares favorably=
 with
crime rates for Washington County as a whole, which in 2000 had experienced
32.1 Part 1 crimes and 100.1 Part 2 crimes per thousand county residents,
respectively.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In addition to the police department, </span><!--[if gte=
 vml 1]><v:shape
 id=3D"_x0000_s2068" type=3D"#_x0000_t75" style=3D'position:absolute;left:0;
 text-align:left;margin-left:0;margin-top:84pt;width:296.7pt;height:159.2pt;
 z-index:19;mso-wrap-distance-top:7.2pt;mso-wrap-distance-bottom:7.2pt;
 mso-position-horizontal:left;mso-position-horizontal-relative:margin;
 mso-position-vertical-relative:page' stroked=3D"t" strokeweight=3D"1.25pt">
 <v:imagedata src=3D"TownPlan_files/image034.wmz" o:title=3D""/>
 <w:wrap type=3D"square" side=3D"largest" anchorx=3D"margin" anchory=3D"pag=
e"/>
</v:shape><![if gte mso 9]><o:OLEObject Type=3D"Embed" ProgID=3D"Excel.Shee=
t.8"

</o:OLEObject>
<![endif]><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D400 height=3D216
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image035.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D12 vspace=3D10 v:=
shapes=3D"_x0000_s2068"><![endif]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Norwich University provides private, on-campus security
services.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This has the effect=
 of
reducing the burden on the police department. The unique law enforcement ne=
eds
associated with hosting a college in the community, however, place ongoing
off-campus pressures on the department.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nb=
sp;
</span>As the university &#8211; and community &#8211; grow, it is likely t=
hat
an additional full time officer will be required to maintain existing cover=
age;
one addition has already been budgeted. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Major equipment used by the police department, including
patrol vehicles, are replaced on a scheduled basis.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A reserve fund has been establishe=
d for
that purpose.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition to
vehicle replacement, the most pressing facility issue facing the department=
 is
the need for building improvements.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>The department is presently housed in the old electric department
building in the village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>That
facility does not meet current life-safety standards.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>No plans presently exist for renov=
ating
the police station, and such plans are partly dependent upon other discussi=
ons
concerning the municipal offices and fire and rescue facilities.<o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Enhanced 911<o:p></o:p></span></u><=
/b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>A state board supervises the operation of Vermont&#8217;s
Enhanced-911 system, instituted in the 1990s.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This includes monitoring and audit=
ing
E-911 databases for street addresses, contact information and responders, t=
he
E-911 network, and four public safety answering points (PSAPs) which take
calls, and forward them to local dispatchers.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The system depends on regular info=
rmation
updates from municipalities to ensure complete coverage.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In Northfield, the ambulance servi=
ce is
responsible for maintaining the local &#8220;E-911&#8221; emergency response
system. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>7.4<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><i style=3D'mso-b=
idi-font-style:
normal'>Water &amp; Sewer Facilities</i><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in .25in'><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Water Sy=
stem<o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in .25in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p><span style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span><=
/o:p></span></h4>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in .25in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;text-underline:no=
ne'>Northfield
Village has maintained a public water system since establishing a water
department in 1895.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The system
serves the entire village (approximately 750 users), in addition to
approximately 300 users outside village limits in Northfield Falls and
Northfield Center.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Current de=
mand
for water is 520,000 gallons per day (gpd), 300,000 gpd of which is
metered.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Water is distributed
through approximately 25 miles of water mains.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition to providing potable w=
ater,
the system includes 130 hydrants that provide a high level of fire protecti=
on
with the service area.<o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
source of water is an automated system of wells adjacent to Route 12A and t=
he
Dog River, just south of the Route 12 junction.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This system was upgraded in 2000.<=
span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition to the upgrade, a new
1,000,000-gallon reservoir was constructed on Garvey Hill.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The reservoir and well upgrade were
funded through a $1.9 million bond.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>As a result, the system has a three-day reserve capacity, improved f=
ire
protection capacity, and ample capacity to accommodate anticipated growth f=
or
the foreseeable future.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Additional upgrades and
improvements to the water system are planned, along with steps to protect t=
he
existing water supply from potential future contamination.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A source protection plan has been
prepared, as required by state and federal regulations.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The most significant threat to the=
 water
source identified is that posed by possible septic contamination from exist=
ing
land uses, especially two mobile home parks in the vicinity.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>To avoid contamination, the wastew=
ater
collection system is planned to be extended to serve residential parcels wi=
thin
the source protection area.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>O=
ther
planned improvements include updating and/or replacing the 100-year old wat=
er
mains and railroad crossings, improving system security, and planning for t=
he
replacement of the Cheney Farm Reservoirs in 2020.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5in;text-align:justify'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5in;text-align:justify'><b><u><=
span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Sewage
Disposal<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5in;text-align:justify'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Like
the water system, Northfield&#8217;s wastewater treatment facility is owned=
 and
operated by the village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Loca=
ted
adjacent to Route 12 in the village, the facility&#8217;s service area incl=
udes
the entire village and most of Northfield Center, including Norwich Univers=
ity.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5in;text-align:justify'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Constructed
in 1967, the facility has a treatment capacity of 1.6 million gallons per d=
ay
(GPD), although current flows of 400,000 GPD from approximately 730 connect=
ions
is well below the maximum capacity.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Due to outdated treatment technology &#8211; and changes to industri=
al
processes used in local textile industries that altered the composition of
waste entering the system &#8211; the treatment facility is presently in
violation of state wastewater discharge standards.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Given existing and potential pollu=
tion
of the Dog River, it is critical that the facility be brought into complian=
ce
with all applicable standards.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>In
2002 the village passed a $7 million bond to overhaul the facility and expa=
nd
the local service area.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The u=
pgrade
will reduce phosphorus levels and address other concerns to bring the facil=
ity
into compliance with state standards.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>As a result, the maximum capacity of the treatment plant will be red=
uced
to 1.0 million GPD, which will still allow significant capacity for new and
expanded users.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition, =
the
service area will be extended south of the university to encompass the area
surrounding the municipal well fields, eliminating threats to the municipal
water supply.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>No other facility improvements or expansions to the serv=
ice
area are anticipated.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It has =
been
suggested that the system extend to Northfield Falls; however the extension
would require a forced main, and is consequently considered too costly at t=
his
time.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Given the historic
concentration of development in the area &#8211; all served by private, in
ground septic systems &#8211; such an extension may be necessary in the fut=
ure,
should the need arise.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>It
has also been suggested that the system extend to the area adjacent to the
Route 12/Route 64 intersection to serve possible industrial development.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such an extension would be cost
prohibitive without a major user, however, and recent changes to state fund=
ing
programs for sewer facilities would likely make such an extension to serve
development outside of recognized growth centers ineligible for state and
federal funding.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Therefore, s=
uch an
extension is likely to occur only if it is privately funded.<o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Outside
of the sewer service area, residences and businesses are responsible for
disposal of wastewater through in-ground systems.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Since 2002, all new systems requir=
e a
permit from the Vermont Agency of Natural Resources and must comply with st=
ate
design standards.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Alterations=
 to
existing systems currently do not require a state permit, although permit
requirements will be phased in until such alterations fall under state
requirements in 2007.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p><span style=3D'text-deco=
ration:
 none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Water
&amp; Sewer Department</span></u></b><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></u></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Although
the village maintains separate water and sewer departments for budgeting
purposes, the two systems share supervisory, technical, and administrative
staff.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Presently, the water a=
nd
sewer departments are staffed by four full-time workers who are cross-train=
ed
as licensed water and wastewater facility operators.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>In
addition to staffing needs, the water department has historically been loca=
ted
in the municipal building, while the sewer department has stored equipment =
and
operated from the treatment plant.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>The consolidation of the operation at the treatment plant would resu=
lt
in a more efficient operation while providing options for more efficient us=
e of
the municipal building.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>If su=
ch a
consolidation of maintenance functions occurs, however, residents should st=
ill
have access to administrative staff in the Village for such purposes as pay=
ing
bills and seeking information.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5in;text-align:justify'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>7.5
<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Recreation<o:p></=
o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5in;text-align:justify'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
residents enjoy a variety of public recreation facilities and programs not
available in smaller communities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Recreation facilities and programs are overseen by a seven-member
Recreation Board (appointed by the Selectmen) and several local volunteer
organizations.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The board hire=
s a
seasonal recreation director to coordinate the use of the pool by the summer
program and the swimming program, and to oversee the operation of the munic=
ipal
pool and maintenance of other facilities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&=
nbsp;
</span>Lifeguards and maintenance workers are also hired on a seasonal basi=
s.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The total recreation budget in 200=
1 was
$46,710. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
two developed recreation facilities are:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=
:3.0pt;
margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l41 level1=
 lfo35;
tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Win=
gdings;
mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><sp=
an
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Memorial Park, </span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0p=
t;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>which
includes the municipal outdoor swimming pool, a skateboard park, outdoor
volley-ball court and playing fields suitable for baseball, softball, and
soccer; and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.25in;text-align:justify;text-ind=
ent:
-.25in;mso-list:l41 level1 lfo35;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]=
><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;
mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:Wingdings'><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&sect;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"=
'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><sp=
an
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield Falls Fields</span></b><span style=3D'font-si=
ze:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'>,
which include playing fields suitable for soccer, Little League baseball and
softball, as well as volleyball courts.<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:nor=
mal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Combined,
these facilities provide adequate space and facilities to serve existing
demands for organized field space and less formal youth recreation.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A short-range plan of the Recreati=
on
Board is to connect the two facilities with the construction of an off-road,
multi-purpose recreation path.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </spa=
n>Such
a path would also provide a pedestrian and bicyclist connection between Nor=
thfield
Falls and Northfield Village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>In
addition, the proposed path connection between the downtown and Norwich
University, and associated development of an &#8220;eco-park&#8221; along t=
he
Dog River, would further enhance recreation and transportation opportunities
(see Chapters 5 and 6).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>In
addition to developed facilities, Northfield also boasts a well developed
network of winter trails maintained by the Vermont Association of Snow
Travelers (VAST), excellent fishing opportunities in the Dog River and
tributary streams, good hunting (in large part made possible by private
landowners); and hiking trails on Paine Mountain.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Trails to Paine Mountain cross the
municipal forest, lands owned by Norwich University and the local telephone
company. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>7.6<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Solid Waste Manag=
ement<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
is one of 22 member towns forming the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:norm=
al'>Central
Vermont Solid Waste Management District (CVSWMD)</b>, first organized in
1984.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The district, governed =
by a
board of supervisors made up of an appointed representative from each
municipality, is charged with administering regional programs for the
reduction, reuse, recycling, and disposal of solid waste.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>District planning and programs are
funded primarily through a municipal per capita assessment ($2.10 in FY03),=
 and
a surcharge on trash generated within the district ($16/ton in FY03).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield&#8217;s municipal asses=
sment,
included annually in the Selectboard&#8217;s budget, was set at $12,140 for
2001-02 &#8211; up significantly (41%) from previous years due to rising
administrative costs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></=
o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b><=
/p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Programs</span></u></b><u><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></u></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
district offers several programs to help member communities reduce, reuse a=
nd
recycle solid waste, including recycling depots, hazardous waste collection=
s,
illegal dumping and burning programs, Green Up Day grants, an award-winning
DeTox Family Program, junk car removal assistance, clothing reuse (&#8220;d=
rop
and swap&#8221;) events, and a reuse business grant program.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The district also negotiates contr=
acts
with private entities for waste collection and disposal. <o:p></o:p></span>=
</p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Recycling</span></u></b><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
District&#8217;s mandatory recycling ordinance went into effect in 1995.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Each hauler licensed by the distri=
ct to
collect garbage must also offer collection of mandatory recyclables
&#8211;newspaper, clear glass, #2 plastic containers, tin and aluminum cans
and, in addition for businesses, corrugated cardboard and white paper.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Many haulers and drop-off location=
s also
collect additional materials, increasing the total diversion rate to around=
 30%
of the waste stream.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Locally,=
 trash
and recyclables are collected at the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:norma=
l'>Northfield
Dog River Depot,</b> located at the Public Works Yard off North Main Street=
, which
has been managed by the district since 1997.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></u></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Solid
Waste Disposal</span></u></b><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font=
-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:=
p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText2 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-si=
ze:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>The district has not yet undertaken a waste
generation survey to determine the amount of waste generated from each of i=
ts
member communities; however, nearly 40,000 tons of garbage (or 3.5 pounds p=
er
person per day) from the district is land filled annually.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The majority of waste (73%) is shi=
pped
to the Waste USA landfill in Coventry, another 25% ends up at the Waste Sys=
tems
International (WSI, formerly Palisades) landfill facility in Moretown, and a
small amount (2%) is delivered to Bethlehem, New Hampshire.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Given the distance to these end
facilities, portions of the region&#8217;s trash are dumped and packed into
trailers at transfer stations in Hardwick and East Montpelier.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Disposal
currently costs between $75 and $98 per ton &#8211; an estimated $2.8 to $3=
.7
million annually for the district.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>The cost to local residents is currently $2.25 for each 30 gallon/25
pound bag of trash.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The distr=
ict
anticipates no reduction in these rates, even as additional landfill capaci=
ty
is developed statewide.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
Waste USA facility has permitted capacity through 2009.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>WSI&#8217;s permit extends through=
 2007;
however, they are expected to seek authorization to open another cell prior=
 to
permit expiration.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 1993, a=
nd
again in 2001, citizens in the district overwhelmingly opposed the siting o=
f a
new landfill within the region.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Accordingly, the CVSWMD currently has no intent to pursue a
district-owned landfill, but will be re-evaluating its landfill siting crit=
eria
for the review of any proposed private landfill facilities.<o:p></o:p></spa=
n></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Solid
Waste Planning</span></u></b><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font=
-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:=
p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Under
Act 78, passed by the state in 1987, CVSWMD must develop plans and programs
that are consistent with the state&#8217;s solid waste implementation
plan.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The district is current=
ly
updating its solid waste plan for state approval, scheduled for completion =
in
the winter of 2003.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Over the =
life
of this plan, the district intends to embrace a &#8220;zero waste&#8221;
philosophy that emphasizes resource conservation through the reuse and
recycling of materials.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In
addition, all solid waste management facilities, including proposed landfil=
ls,
must be identified in the district plan in order to receive certification f=
rom
the state.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Proposed solid was=
te
management facilities are also subject to local regulations and require the
support of the host community.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>7.7<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Health &amp; Soci=
al
Services<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>There
have been dramatic changes over the past several years in health care and in
service and insurance industries, resulting in rising costs and increased
differentiation among service providers to access available federal and sta=
te
funding.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Many industry proble=
ms,
including rising health care costs, are beyond the reach of municipalities =
and
local organizations to address, but affect local businesses, workers,
residents, and municipal budgets.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Coordination and collaboration between funding agencies and service
providers to ensure the effective delivery of services is more important th=
an
ever, and could be improved through local information and referral
services.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is also reasonab=
le to
expect that volunteer efforts, and municipal funding and support for local
service organizations, will become more important given anticipated cuts in
state and federal programs.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>A
variety of private, state and nonprofit agencies provide health and social
services to Northfield residents.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Of particular importance locally are services provided to
Northfield&#8217;s elderly population, and to children and families in need=
.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>State and regional services are
generally based in Montpelier or Barre.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nb=
sp;
</span>Many area nonprofits, described below, have a local presence, and de=
pend
in part on volunteers, municipal funding, and donations for support.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Non-budgeted municipal appropriati=
ons to
requesting organizations are decided annually by town voters.<o:p></o:p></s=
pan></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Health
Care Services</span></u></b><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:=
p></span></u></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
residents have access to general health care services locally through sever=
al
private practitioners&#8211; Green Mountain Family Practice and several den=
tal
practices.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><b style=3D'mso-bi=
di-font-weight:
normal'>The People&#8217;s Health and Wellness Clinic</b> in Barre also off=
ers
health care services to area residents who are uninsured.<o:p></o:p></span>=
</p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
town&#8217;s hospital closed several years ago; however, the <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Mayo Health Care</b> facility now ser=
ves as<b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> </b>a 50-bed Level I/II nursing home=
 that provides
intensive and intermediate residential nursing care and therapies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>There are also three state-licensed
Level III care facilities in town &#8211; Four Season Care Home, Mayo Assis=
ted
Living, and Mayo-DeLary House &#8211; which provide room and board, personal
care, 24-hour non-medical supervision, and limited nursing services to seni=
ors
and adults with disabilities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>The
three facilities have a combined capacity of 113 residents. <o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Central Vermont Medical Center</b>=
 in
Berlin is the region&#8217;s full-service hospital, providing patients with
emergency, medical, surgical, psychiatric, pediatric and social services,
including counseling and referrals to area health and welfare agencies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A variety of outpatient services a=
re
also available.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield
residents also have access to the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>=
Gifford
Memorial Hospital</b>, located in Randolph.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Both hospitals are associated with=
 the
Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center, in Lebanon, New Hampshire.<o:p></o:p></=
span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Social
Services</span></u></b><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-famil=
y:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </sp=
an><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Locally,
<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Community Emergency Relief Volunte=
ers</b>
(CERV) provides food, clothing, utility, and other emergency assistance to
residents in need.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>CERV also =
runs
the local food shelf, located in the town&#8217;s ambulance garage.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It receives no public funding and
operates through the generosity of the Northfield community and local
businesses.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Central Vermont Community Action C=
ouncil
</b>(CVCAC), based in Berlin, offers a wide range of programs to serve the
needs of low-income households and residents in the region &#8211; including
food assistance, emergency fuel and weatherization, family support, Head St=
art,
welfare-to-work, and community economic development programs.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Community Action offers emergency
assistance, to help offset the immediate impacts of poverty, and also long-=
term
support for those working their way out of poverty.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2000, CVCAC helped 284 Northfie=
ld
residents and 197 families.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></u></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Senior
Services<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Greater Northfield Senior Center, =
</b>on
Wall Street<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>, </b>serves as a gathe=
ring
place for local residents, and offers a variety of health and social progra=
ms
and events, often in association with area agencies, to serve the town&#821=
7;s
senior population.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The center
offers regular health screening, workshops, and an on-site meals program.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weig=
ht:normal'>Central
Vermont Council on Aging</b> (CVCOA) is a private, nonprofit group that pro=
vides
support services for seniors, directly or under contract with local groups =
and
organizations, to live independently in their homes and communities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2000, case management services =
were
provided to 65 town residents.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </spa=
n>The
Council also contracts annually with the Northfield Senior Center to provide
community and home delivered meals (&#8220;Meals on Wheels&#8221;).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Meals are served at the center Mon=
day
through Friday, for a donation.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Transportation assistance is provided under contract with Green Moun=
tain
Transit Agency.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The area&#821=
7;s <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Retired and Senior Volunteer Program<=
/b>
(RSVP) organizes opportunities for seniors to volunteer their services to a
variety of community groups.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>=
Monies
