raised locally are used to help offset the cost of supporting volunteer
activities.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Youth &amp; Family Services</span><=
/u></b><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-=
bidi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span></span></=
b><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>There are currently twelve state registered child care
providers operating in Northfield, including three day care centers: the
Northfield Community Day Care Center, the Northfield Early Education Progra=
m,
and St. Mary&#8217;s Nursery School.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>The <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Family Center of Washin=
gton
County, </b>based in Montpelier<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>, <=
/b>is
the area&#8217;s childcare resource and referral agency.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Center also provides preschool=
 and
after-school child care services, playgroups, parent education and support
activities, training for childcare providers, and assistance to parents to =
pay
for child care services.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 2=
000,
the Center assisted 374 Northfield residents.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>The </span><b style=3D'mso-bid=
i-font-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Northfield Boys &amp; Girls C=
lub</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'> was established to provide a supervised place for youth=
 to
congregate that is safe and secure from dangerous and/or illegal substances;
provides youth an opportunity to plan and take part in social, recreational,
and educational activities and community service; and allows youth to
experience democracy by exercising self governance under the guidance of an
adult advisor.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Club&#8217=
;s
credo is &#8220;Honor Youth.&#8221;<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>The Club, which is open to any youth from Northfield, Roxbury, and
Riverton, provides a number of programs including community service.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It operates out of a facility adja=
cent
to the downtown.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The <b>Northfield/Roxbury Drug Free Communities Support
Program</b> is funded by the U.S. Department of Justice.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The program&#8217;s goals are to r=
educe
substance abuse among youth and to form a coalition of community groups who=
se
members will focus on helping to provide resources to create a healthy
environment with emphasis on the prevention of substance abuse.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>To achieve these goals, grants are
awarded to youth-serving groups in support of their programs designed to re=
duce
risks that lead to substance use and abuse.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Other strategies include coalition
building with adult leaders and youth, increased media attention and the
evaluation of youth use and attitudes towards alcohol, tobacco, and other d=
rugs.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Good
Beginnings of Central Vermont, </span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>based
in Northfield, is a nonprofit program that provides volunteer support and
education to new parents and their newborn or adopted babies, to help ease =
the
transition into parenthood.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Volunteers visit all families with infants, and also work with local=
 libraries
to distribute information.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Th=
e <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Washington County Youth Service Burea=
u</b>
provides crisis intervention, parenting, family counseling, substance abuse
services, and transitional living programs for runaway and homeless youths.=
<b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbs=
p;
</span></b>In 2000, services were provided to 75 Northfield youths and fami=
ly
members.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><b style=3D'mso-bidi=
-font-weight:
normal'>Battered Women&#8217;s Services and Shelter</b>, opened in 1990 in
Montpelier, provides services to more than 1000 victims of domestic violence
annually.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The closest homeless
shelter is the Good Samaritan shelter in Barre.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:no=
rmal'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:l=
ine'><br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></i></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>7.8<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Communications
Services &amp; Facilities<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield is served by both traditional and more modern
forms of communication that inform the community, connect residents with ea=
ch
other, and increasingly the wider world.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p><span
 style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Newspapers<o:p></o:p></span></u></b=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Northfield News</i></b><i style=3D'mso=
-bidi-font-style:
normal'>,</i> the local weekly newspaper, was first established in 1878, an=
d is
the municipality&#8217;s official newspaper for public warnings, notices, a=
nd
announcements.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Many Northfield
residents also get their news from the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:nor=
mal'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Times-Argus</i></b>, central Vermont&#=
8217;s
daily paper based out of Barre, which offers some local coverage.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Norwich University&#8217;s newspap=
er, <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'>The
Norwich Guidon</i>, </b>also covers some local events.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p><span
 style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Telecommunications<o:p></o:p></span=
></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Telecommunications facilities and services, until very
recently, were limited to local and long distance phone systems, and wirele=
ss
radio and television networks.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </spa=
n>The
information access provided by cell phones and &#8220;personal digital
assistants&#8221; (PDAs), on-line Internet services, and the World Wide Web=
 was
unheard of a decade ago.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Tele=
communications
services available to Northfield residents are now multiplying at an
unprecedented rate, due to ongoing technological advances and an expanding
number of local and national service providers.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Technology and deregulation have blurred the lines betwe=
en
what were once distinct, separately regulated services &#8211; phone and ca=
ble
systems are now used as much for data transfer as for more traditional form=
s of
communication.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Wired and wire=
less
networks are being developed that allow for high-speed internet access, voi=
ce
and data integration, video conferencing, distance and on-line learning, and
telecommuting.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Telecommunications networks that support new information
technologies and provide access to worldwide information and markets are al=
so
important economic engines.<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span></b>This is most evident locally in
recent federal funding for the development of the <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'>National Center for the Study of Cyber-Terrorism and Cyber Crime</b=
> at
Norwich University, scheduled to go on-line in 2003.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As a result of this center, Northf=
ield
is expected to become a regional hub for cutting-edge technology research a=
nd
education.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Unlike traditional phone and broadcast networks, availab=
le
for a nominal fee or the cost of purchasing a radio or television, many of =
the new
technologies and services require a substantial initial capital investment
(e.g., for computers, dishes or wiring), and subsequent monthly payments.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>There is also a learning curve
associated with the use and application of new technologies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As a result, there is a growing
information or &#8220;digital divide,&#8221; which affects mostly lower inc=
ome
households and the elderly on fixed incomes, who also are often less famili=
ar
or comfortable with new technologies.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Telephone
Service</span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weig=
ht:normal'>Northfield
Telephone Company</b>, first established in 1896, is the area&#8217;s incum=
bent
local exchange company.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is=
 now a
subsidiary of Telephone and Data Systems Inc. (<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-we=
ight:
normal'>TDS Telecom</b>), a national telecommunications provider with local=
 and
regional offices in Northfield.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </sp=
an>TDS
provides a variety of phone, data, and Internet services to Northfield and
Roxbury area businesses and residents for monthly fees.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Local consumers have the option of
selecting from a variety of long-distance telephone service providers.<o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In 2002 TDS agreed, in response to an order from the Ver=
mont
Public Service Board, to reduce its local residential and business rates wi=
thin
the Northfield calling area, which encompasses approximately 53,000
subscribers; to use associated reserves to help offset costs incurred by lo=
cal
schools participating in the state&#8217;s &#8220;Distance Learning&#8221;
initiative; and to continue expanding broadband services, including Digital
Subscriber Line (DSL) services, to a wider area.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>TDS also participates in &#8220;Li=
nk Up
Vermont,&#8221; which provides subsidized phone installation services for
income-eligible residents.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o=
:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Wireless P=
hone
Services</span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0p=
t;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Cellular phone service is also
improving, but because of local topography, remains spotty in the Dog River
valley.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Providers are actively
pursuing tower sites throughout Vermont to expand cellular coverage.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield, under the federal 1996
Telecommunications Act, cannot exclude such facilities, but can regulate th=
eir
siting and appearance through local zoning or ordinances.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Emissions, including related
interference and health considerations, are regulated separately by the Fed=
eral
Communications Commission (FCC).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p><span
 style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Radio,
Television &amp; Cable.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span></spa=
n></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Because of the mountainous terrain, Northfield residents
without cable or satellite service get limited radio and television recepti=
on.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Norwich University&#8217;s noncomm=
ercial
radio station, <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>WNUB</b> (88.3 FM) =
has
been broadcasting to central Vermonters for 35 years.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The station&#8217;s signal is
transmitted from a 30-foot tower located on the roof of Jackman Hall, and
reaches listeners within a 10-mile radius.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>=
&nbsp;
</span><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Trans-Video Inc., </b>based=
 in
Norwich, provides cable television packages for a monthly fee.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Trans-Video also provides three ch=
annels
for public, educational, and government (PEG) use, as required by the Vermo=
nt
Public Service Board (e.g., Channel 7, 15, and 16).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Currently meetings of the Selectme=
n and
Trustees are broadcast on Channel 7 but other local programming is
limited.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield residents=
 outside
the cable service area have access to other wireless television services.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Due to recent regulatory changes,
satellite subscribers now have access to programming generated in Vermont.<=
span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Two satellite companies provide se=
rvice
in Northfield.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><b style=3D'ms=
o-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>Vermont Interactive Television</b> offers videoconferencing service=
s to
businesses, government, nonprofit organizations, and schools at fourteen si=
tes
around the state.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The closest=
 sites
to Northfield are at the Vermont Technical College in Randolph Center, and =
at
state offices in Waterbury.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p><span
 style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Internet
&amp; Web Services<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Increasingly, more information and services, including
government and educational services, are being provided through web sites,
accessed through the Internet.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Northfield residents with a phone line, computer, and modem, or a di=
rect
line connection, have access to a growing number of local and national Inte=
rnet
Service Providers (ISPs) &#8211; and a variety of associated services,
including e-mail, file and data transfer services, web sites, and access to=
 the
World Wide Web.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Residential
Internet services currently offered through TDS include dialup access, Digi=
tal
Service Lines (DSLs), and web hosting.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbs=
p;
</span>Businesses also may have access to dedicated (Integrated Services
Digital Network [ISDN] and T1) lines for higher speed service.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Trans-Video offers its cable custo=
mers
cable modem Internet access.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>=
For
residents without a computer or cable service, the Brown Public Library now
offers public on-line access, in partnership with TDS and Norwich
University.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Senior Center
offers classes and online access for senior citizens.<b style=3D'mso-bidi-f=
ont-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></b></spa=
n></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The Internet is increasingly important as an educational
tool for information access and on-line (&#8220;distance&#8221;) learning
opportunities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield sch=
ools
have broadband access to online services and resources through &#8220;K12ne=
t,&#8221;
an extension of Vermont&#8217;s GOVnet, which supports local and distance
learning programs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Washin=
gton
South Supervisory Union and both Northfield schools maintain basic web site=
s,
and participate in VITA-Learn, the Vermont Information Technology Associati=
on for
the Advancement of Learning, which encourages the use of information
technologies to meet Vermont educational standards.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Norwich University has also establ=
ished
on-line courses, including an on-line MBA program for business professional=
s. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The current Northfield web site (www.<a name=3D"_Hlt4223=
2510">n</a>orthfieldvt.com)
was developed and is maintained by the Northfield Business &amp; Profession=
al
Association.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>NBPA offers the =
site
as a resource for both local residents and visitors.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Current web pages include a brief
history of the town and its four villages, community and municipal informat=
ion,
listings of health, senior, educational, and recreational resources, and li=
nks
to local businesses.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A separa=
te
municipal web site is currently under development.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>7.9<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Cultural
Facilities &amp; Activities<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p><span
 style=3D'text-decoration:none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Brown Public Library<o:p></o:p></sp=
an></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The Brown Public Library is governed by an elected Board=
 of
Trustees.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The library is open=
 six
days (43 hours) a week, and is run by an eight-member staff, including a he=
ad
librarian, a youth librarian, and several assistants.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Recent years have witnessed a trem=
endous
increase in both circulation (which reached 21,880 in 2000) and use of the
library&#8217;s Community Room.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </sp=
an>The
library&#8217;s catalog was automated in 1995, the result of hundreds of ho=
urs
of volunteer effort.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Norwich
University has provided computer services to get the library on-line.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is now linked to other librarie=
s all
over the state and worldwide.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>The
library maintains its own web site, and offers free e-mail addresses to
patrons.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The library also off=
ers a
variety of community programs including youth workshops, story hours and su=
mmer
reading programs, adult reading programs, and an off-site circulation servi=
ce
at the Northfield Senior Center.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Friends of=
 the
Brown Public Library</span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> is a
membership-based nonprofit group organized to support the activities of the
library through fundraising activities and volunteer efforts.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The organization currently include=
s over
150 area families, and is financed through annual membership dues, the sale=
 of
book bags, and gifts.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Fri=
ends,
in consultation with the librarian and library trustees, use funds raised e=
ach
year to purchase books and equipment, and support library programs.<o:p></o=
:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In 1995 the Library developed an expansion plan that wou=
ld
more than double the size of the building, modernize facilities, and enhance
patron services.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It would also
include a new permanent home for the Northfield Historical Society in the
historic Paine House (the former site of the American Legion).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Over several years, the library in
conjunction with the Northfield Historical Society conducted an ambitious f=
und
raising effort to raise $1.3 million.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>This resulted in substantial federal and state grants, and private
donations, including $100,000 from the Northfield Savings Bank and $50,000 =
from
Norwich University.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In Septem=
ber
1998, town voters approved a $400,00 bond for the project to go forward.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Renovations and expansion were com=
pleted
in 1999.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></=
p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Community Organizations &amp; Event=
s<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield is home to nearly forty service, educational =
and
community organizations that support a wide variety of local activities and
cultural events, and contribute much to community life.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Norwich University also supports
community activities though its community service and youth mentoring progr=
ams,
and by making university facilities available for use by community groups.<=
o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The Greater Northfield Arts Activities Group, Inc., is a
not-for-profit community organization formed in 1999 and dedicated to build=
ing
multi-generational relationships that engender mutual respect, responsibili=
ty,
and recognition by bringing together children, youths, and adults to perfor=
m,
produce, and exhibit for the enjoyment of themselves and others.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>All events, workshops, meetings, a=
nd
programs are substance free (including a prohibition of alcohol and tobacco=
). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Annual events that attract both local residents and visi=
tors
include the Vermont Quilt Festival, held in June of each year at Norwich
University; Summer on the Common entertainment series held Tuesday evenings
through July and August; Labor Day Observances and Parade, a three-day fest=
ival
held on the village common; the Haunted Hayride, held two weekends in Octob=
er,
and &#8220;Ellie&#8217;s Farm Market Jock-o-Lantern Show,&#8221; a 25-year
local Halloween event.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northf=
ield
also is known for the annual &#8220;Cabot Hosiery Sock Sale,&#8221; held ea=
ch
fall at the Cabot sock mill and the Barry T. Chouinard, Inc. tee shirt sale=
.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Cultural events attracting outside visitors present
Northfield in a positive light, and also contribute to the local economy.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:n=
ormal'>Northfield
Observances, </b>which<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> </b>organiz=
es the
annual Labor Day festivities, has estimated that this event alone draws
thousands of people to the community, provides over $35,000 in annual reven=
ues
to businesses and organizations that set up booths on Depot Square, and also
supports other Northfield businesses.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Northfield Observances also arranges for additional police coverage =
for
this event, and requests an annual appropriation from town voters each year=
 to
help defray the cost.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Appropr=
iated
funds are paid over directly to the Northfield Police Department.<o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Northfield
Business &amp; Professional Association (NBPA), </b>created in 1978<b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>, </b>serves as a local chamber of co=
mmerce
by promoting member businesses, local economic development, and Northfield =
as a
tourist destination; but it also takes a broader interest in larger issues
affecting the community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>NBPA
sponsors community events, recognizes outstanding community service, repres=
ents
the community in regional organizations, and provides information and assum=
es
positions on issues affecting the community.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>NBPA, as noted, also maintains
Northfield&#8217;s web site on behalf of the community at large.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Membership is open to anyone who l=
ives
in the greater Northfield area, or who is associated with a local service,
business, or professional activity. <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal=
'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></i></b></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:no=
rmal'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:l=
ine'><br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></i></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n lines-together'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>7.10 <span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp; </span>Commu=
nity
Facilities &amp; Services Goals, Policies &amp; Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i>=
</b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n lines-together'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n lines-together'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Community
Facilities &amp; Services Goal</span></i></b><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weig=
ht:
normal'><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Ro=
man"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n lines-together'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<div style=3D'mso-element:para-border-div;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText3 style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-or=
phan lines-together'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The provision of effective and cost efficient community
services, facilities, and utilities is needed to meet present and future de=
mands
of Northfield citizens and visitors.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:4.55pt;text-align:justify;mso-pag=
ination:
widow-orphan lines-together'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeading7 style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orp=
han lines-together;
tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in .5in 1.0in 1.5in 2.0in 2.5in 3.0in 3.5in 4.0in 4.5in=
 5.0in 5.5in 6.0in 6.5in'><i>Community
Facilities &amp; Services Policies<o:p></o:p></i></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-pagination:widow-orpha=
n lines-together'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DLevel1 style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:3.=
0pt;
margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;mso-pagination:widow-=
orphan lines-together;
mso-list:l1 level1 lfo36'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-family:"=
Arial Narrow";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Narrow";mso-bidi-font-family:"Arial Narrow"'=
><span
style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&n=
bsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp=
;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Provide
municipal services and facilities in an efficient and cost effective manner=
 to
ensure a high level of service without creating an undue financial burden on
taxpayers.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>To this end:<o:p><=
/o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent2 style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;marg=
in-bottom:
3.0pt;margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;mso-pagination:
widow-orphan lines-together;mso-list:l50 level1 lfo37;tab-stops:.5in'><![if=
 !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:9.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&middot=
;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Village and Town governments should continue to coordina=
te
and cooperate to avoid redundancies and maximize efficiency; wherever possi=
ble,
facilities and services should be shared;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent2 style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;marg=
in-bottom:
3.0pt;margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;mso-pagination:
widow-orphan lines-together;mso-list:l20 level1 lfo38;tab-stops:.5in'><![if=
 !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:9.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&middot=
;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Alternatives to the property tax to fund local services
(grants, user fees, etc.) will be used wherever practical;<o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent2 style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;marg=
in-bottom:
3.0pt;margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;mso-pagination:
widow-orphan lines-together;mso-list:l20 level1 lfo38;tab-stops:.5in'><![if=
 !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:9.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&middot=
;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Capital expenditures will be programmed to avoid sharp
fluctuations in the property tax rate;<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent2 style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;marg=
in-bottom:
3.0pt;margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.5in;mso-pagination:
widow-orphan lines-together;mso-list:l44 level1 lfo39;tab-stops:.5in'><![if=
 !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:9.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&middot=
;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The municipality will coordinate with neighboring commun=
ities
to share services and associated costs to the extent practical;<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent2 style=3D'margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify;
text-indent:-.5in;mso-pagination:widow-orphan lines-together;mso-list:l34 l=
evel1 lfo40;
tab-stops:.5in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:9.0pt;mso-bid=
i-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-fami=
ly:
Symbol'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&middot;<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "=
Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Expansion of not-for-profit institutions, including Norw=
ich
University, shall be planned in a manner that does not place an undue burde=
n on
municipal services and facilities or result in an undue adverse impact on t=
he
property tax rate.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

><span

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;

<p class=3DLevel1 style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:=

10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Continue to
participate in the Central Vermont Solid Waste District and support the
District&#8217;s efforts to promote recycling and reduce waste generation.<=

</span>[Selectmen/Trustees and Staff].<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoTitle><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0=
pt'>Chapter
8.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Local Education<o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoTitle style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:1=
1.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;text-transform:uppercase'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h1 style=3D'text-align:justify'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>8.1 <span style=3D'mso=
-tab-count:
1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Overview<o:p></o:p></span></i></h1>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The goal of the Northfield School system is to
&#8220;encourage the highest quality educational system for all students of
Northfield, and to encourage preparedness to handle the future of (the) sch=
ool
system&#8217;s growth.&#8221;<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>The
town has worked toward this goal through the Northfield School Board, sever=
al
volunteer organizations, and the Washington South Supervisory Union, which,
together with the Town of Roxbury, helps to oversee separate elementary sch=
ools
in each community and the Northfield Middle/High School (6-12) in Northfield
Village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This chapter provides
brief background information regarding the school system, and identifies is=
sues
likely to affect the system in the coming years.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in 5.5in 5.75in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>8.2 <span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <=
/span>School
Facilities</span></i></b><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in 5.5in 5.75in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in 5.5in 5.75in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield educates all pre-Kindergarten (PK) through gr=
ade
12 students at a central location on Cross Street in Northfield Village.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition to the school complex,=
 the
Community owns the adjacent 160 acre Cook Farm, located to the northwest of=
 the
schools, which is used for school related studies and activities.<o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in 5.5in 5.75in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Elementary School.</span></b>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Students =
in PK
through grade 5 are educated at the Comiskey School.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Comiskey School is administere=
d by
the five-member Northfield School Board elected by Town voters.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A summary of recent trends and
conditions regarding school participation, class size, access to technology=
 and
staffing is presented in Table 8.1.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5in;text-align:justify;tab-stop=
s:-.5in 0in .5in .75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in 1.75in 2.0in 2.25in 2.5in 2.75in =

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Originally built in 1978, the school was upgraded in
1994.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Due to the 1994 upgrade=
, the
current facility is adequate to meet anticipated enrollments for the
foreseeable future (see section 10.3, below).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>One deficiency that exists, howeve=
r, is
the lack of outdoor recreation facilities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>=
&nbsp;
</span>Expansion of existing recreation fields is limited by terrain, other
physical constraints (e.g. wetlands), and adjacent residential neighborhood=
s.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp=
;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Northfield Middle/High
School.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span></span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Northfield Middle/High School is located in a shared
facility adjacent to the Comiskey School on Cross Street.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The facility, which provides educa=
tional
services for middle school (grade 6-8) and high school (grade 9-12) student=
s,
respectively, from Northfield and Roxbury<a style=3D'mso-footnote-id:ftn5'
href=3D"#_ftn5" name=3D"_ftnref5" title=3D""><span class=3DMsoFootnoteRefer=
ence><sup><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-special-character:footnote'><![if !supportFootnotes]><span
class=3DMsoFootnoteReference><sup><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-=
font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi=
-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;
mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'>[5]</span></sup></span><![endif]></span></span></s=
up></span></a>,
is administered by the Northfield School Board.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A summary of recent trends and
conditions regarding school participation, class size, access to technology,
and graduate aspirations is presented in Table 8.1.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in 0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The High School was constructed in 1954 and underwent
substantial upgrade and expansion in 1994, at which time the separate middle
school was established.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The
respective schools operate out of separate portions of the building. <o:p><=
/o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>The school&#8217;s academic
program includes college preparatory, business, and limited vocational
courses.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Curriculum is supple=
mented
with vocational education provided to local students at Randolph Area
Vocational Center (RAVC) &#8211; one of sixteen vocational centers serving
local high schools around the state.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Quite a few high school students take regular college level courses =
at
Norwich University and Vermont Technical College.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In addition, the school offers Adv=
anced
Placement (AP) courses in English, Calculus, History, and Biology.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As described in detail in Chapter =
8, the
Washington South Supervisory Union Board (composed of three Roxbury
representatives and five Northfield representatives) and both Northfield
schools maintain basic web sites, and participate in VITA-Learn, the Vermont
Information Technology Association for the Advancement of Learning, which
encourages the use of information technologies to meet Vermont educational
standards.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span>=
</p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in 0in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>8.3<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp; </span>Enrollment
Trends<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in 0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in 0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Enrollment in both the elementary, middle and high schoo=
ls
has remained relatively stable in recent years.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As explained in Chapter 3, however,
Northfield&#8217;s aging population and modest growth will likely result in
declining enrolments in the coming years.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&=
nbsp;
</span>This is supported by recent trends and enrollment projections provid=
ed
by the Washington South Supervisory Union which are presented in Figure 8.1=
. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

pt;
