  mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=3D104 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:77.75pt;border-top:none;borde=
r-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1=
.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid window=
text .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dright style=3D'text-align:right'><span
  style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>-33.3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style=3D'mso-yfti-irow:8;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=3D606 colspan=3D5 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:454.2pt;border:so=
lid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:s=
olid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman"'>Source:<span
  style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>U.S. Census.<o:p></o:p></span></=
p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>These
data suggest that while fuel oil continues to be the dominant home heating =
source
in town, as it is throughout New England, there has been a shift from
relatively expensive and inefficient electric space heating to more efficie=
nt,
and cleaner burning gas heat.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>New
state energy standards for residential and commercial construction generall=
y no
longer allow electric space heating.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>These standards apply to commercial buildings, including multi-family
dwellings, all new homes, and to residential additions over 500 square feet=
.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Wood,
though a renewable and locally available fuel, has decreased in importance =
as a
primary heating source.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This =
may
change as the price of heating oil continues to rise &#8211; the comparative
cost of wood heat per Btu (a unit of heat energy) is currently about 25% le=
ss
than that of fuel oil.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As exp=
ected,
solar energy is insignificant as a primary residential heating source; howe=
ver
new construction often incorporates passive solar orientation and technique=
s to
reduce space-heating requirements.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>9.3<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Energy Supply<o:p=
></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Electricity</span></u></b><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Northfield Electric Department, </=
b>under
the authority and management of Northfield Village, is one of fifteen munic=
ipal
utilities in Vermont chartered to provide electric service within its
established service area.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The
department&#8217;s territory now includes most of Northfield and part of
Roxbury.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A small area of Nort=
hfield
is served by the Central Vermont Public Service Corporation (CVPS), the
state&#8217;s largest electric utility.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
department serves around 1,600 residential and 180 commercial customers, an=
d maintains
a substation and around 25 miles of transmission and distribution line with=
in
its territory.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>There are curr=
ently
no commercial generating facilities in town.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Line maintenance is also contracted
through Green Mountain Power.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>In
1998 Northfield voters approved a $1.2 million bond to upgrade the
department&#8217;s distribution system, including rebuilding a 12 KV
transmission line, which was completed in August 1999.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This work and a recent substation =
upgrade
are expected to provide customers with needed voltage and reliable service =
for
years to come.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The capital bu=
dget
also anticipates ongoing line and substation circuit upgrades, and pole
replacements.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
Electric purchases around 5 MW of electricity for distribution to its custo=
mers
under contract from outside sources, including Hydro Quebec, the McNeil
generating plant in Burlington, and the Vermont Public Power Supply
Authority.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The department&#82=
17;s
contract with Vermont Yankee ended.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Any excess power is sold on the open market.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The cost of power purchased from
contracted sources increased significantly in the late 1990s, resulting in
annual operating deficits.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In=
 2000
the department applied to the Public Service Board to restructure its rates=
 in
relation to rising power costs, and to maintain competitive commercial
rates.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>In
recent years the state legislature has considered, but not implemented,
statewide utility restructuring that could affect municipal utilities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 1996 a plan was filed by munici=
pal
utilities that recommended the creation of municipal generating companies, =
or
&#8220;Municos,&#8221; that would allow each municipal utility to continue =
to
offer monopoly distribution services within its service territory.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Problems encountered with deregula=
tion
nationally have dampened such initiatives in Vermont, at least for the near
future.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></u></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Fossil
Fuels</span></u></b><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"=
Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Vermont
has no petroleum infrastructure, and relies on tanker trucks for its petrol=
eum
supplies.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Residences and busi=
nesses
are supplied by local oil and gas distributors.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Several gas stations in town serve=
 local
motorists and the traveling public.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Fuel
prices are typically higher in northern New England, and have increased
dramatically in recent months.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>National and regional fuel shortages, compounded by an especially co=
ld
winter in the northeast, have resulted in major increases in the cost of
heating oil, as well as gasoline, kerosene, propane, and diesel fuel.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Recent international events, and o=
ur
heavy reliance on foreign oil, have fueled the ongoing national debate over
energy policy and supplies, and the use of federal fuel reserves.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such events also highlight our
region&#8217;s reliance on limited sources of fuel to supply most of our en=
ergy
needs, and leave local residents &#8211; particularly low income residents
&#8211; very vulnerable to fuel shortages and price fluctuations.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
environmental impacts of such heavy reliance on fossil fuels are also promp=
ting
state efforts to diversify Vermont&#8217;s energy portfolio, to include the=
 use
of cleaner, more efficient natural gas systems, co-generation systems that
produce electricity and heat, and greater reliance on renewable energy
resources, including wood and wind power.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Renewable Energy<o:p></o:p></=
span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Renewable
energy resources found in Northfield include wood, wind power, and limited
solar and hydropower, but the extent to which they can be harnessed and use=
d to
replace other sources of energy is not clear.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The availability since 1998 of
&#8220;net metering&#8221; &#8211; which allows utility customers with
small-scale renewable energy systems to sell excess power back to the utili=
ty
&#8211; may promote increased use of renewable sources.<o:p></o:p></span></=
p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Wood</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A
&#8220;biomass fuel,&#8221; wood is the town&#8217;s most abundant, indigen=
ous
renewable energy source.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>For =
much
of Northfield&#8217;s history, wood was the town&#8217;s principal source of
heat. It is a relatively low cost, renewable energy source that is not
disrupted by embargoes, high transportation costs, or tariffs.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The heavy use of wood for heating,
however, can result in environmental degradation and air pollution.<o:p></o=
:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield
has a large amount of forested land &#8211; including municipal forests &#8=
211;
that under effective management could serve as a renewable source of wood
heat.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Extensive wood harvesti=
ng,
however, if not properly managed, can cause increased stormwater runoff and
soil erosion, sedimentation, water pollution, and habitat loss.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Woodlot management (and adherence =
to
state accepted management practices for logging operations) reduces the adv=
erse
impacts of harvesting operations, and it can enhance local timber stands to=
 meet
a variety of landowner objectives &#8211; including fuel production.<o:p></=
o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Newer
high efficiency wood stoves and furnaces, if properly installed and maintai=
ned,
provide effective home heating.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Stoves sold since 1990 must be airtight and meet EPA emission standa=
rds.
The addition of catalytic converters reduces harmful emissions and particles
that are released into the atmosphere.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbs=
p;
</span>As noted, however, the number of homes in town using wood as a prima=
ry
heating source has declined in recent years.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Though wood-burning technologies h=
ave
improved, wood heat remains less convenient than oil or gas heat.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is anticipated that as heating =
oil
prices increase, more households will use wood as a primary or supplemental
heating source.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Wood
is not currently used to heat Northfield&#8217;s school or municipal buildi=
ngs,
but several other Washington County schools have shifted over to biomass (w=
ood
chip or pellet) heating systems under state-sponsored programs.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Automated, wood-fired systems are
proving to be an affordable heating alternative to conventional oil systems=
 in
such settings.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></s=
pan></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Wind</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Wind is =
an
emission-free renewable energy source that, with rapidly improving turbine
technologies, is receiving increased interest statewide.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In the late 1990s, the Public Serv=
ice
Department, in association with Green Mountain Power and other energy
interests, conducted a statewide wind assessment to determine the potential=
 for
commercial wind energy development.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>This work was updated in 2002 in association with the department&#82=
17;s
efforts to promote utility-based wind energy, and to address related siting
issues.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Tentatively identifie=
d high
wind areas include the ridgeline extending from Irish Hill to Paine Mountai=
n,
and south to Shaw Mountain east of Route 12, and the Northfield Range west =
of
Route 12.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Elevations between =
2000
and 3500 feet above sea level are ideal for maximum power production.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Wind energy projects also typically
require power lines, substations, and access roads.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
extent to which local zoning can regulate wind generation facilities is not=
 yet
clear, since such facilities are also regulated by the Public Service Board=
 and
must be issued a Certificate of Public Good by the state.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Potential impacts of such faciliti=
es,
however, include aesthetic impacts associated with highly visible ridgeline=
 development;
potential impacts to wildlife and wildlife habitat in the vicinity; and
potential safety hazards, when sited in close proximity to other
development.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Some of these im=
pacts
can be mitigated through careful site selection and design, as discussed in=
 the
Department&#8217;s 2002 guide, <i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Wind
Energy Planning Resources for Utility-Scale Systems in Vermont,</i> and rel=
ated
documents.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Hydropower</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Dog =
River
and its tributaries provided waterpower for Northfield&#8217;s earliest mil=
ls
and manufacturing plants.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Tod=
ay
these industries are gone, but the potential remains for small-scale hydrop=
ower
development.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This was long
considered a particularly clean source of renewable energy.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The environmental impacts of dam
construction, operation and management &#8211; including the effects of
changing water levels on river flow, stream habitat and water quality, and =
on
adjoining riparian areas &#8211; are now given much more weight in federal =
and
state dam licensing procedures.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>There are few if any sites locally that are suitable for utility-sca=
led
power plants, but there may be opportunities to develop smaller
&#8220;microhydro systems&#8221; to supply individual users, which would ha=
ve
much less impact on the local environment.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Solar</span></b><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Solar en=
ergy,
like wind and hydro, is one of the few energy resources that is not depleted
with use.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Advances in solar
technology have made it easier, and increasingly affordable, for solar ener=
gy
to be harnessed for residential space and water heating, and for electrical
generation.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Building orientat=
ion
and site exposure are critical to access available energy.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield has some south-facing s=
lopes
that could provide access for both solar heating and solar power on individ=
ual
building sites.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></=
span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
contribution of solar energy to Northfield&#8217;s total supply is likely to
increase only modestly over the next few years.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>More structures are being designed=
 to
take advantage of passive solar energy for heating and light; however not a=
ll
structures can support the panels and systems needed to collect and store s=
olar
energy.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Up front costs for
materials and installation remain relatively expensive for the average
homeowner, and Northfield may not have enough sunny days each year to ensur=
e a
reliable source of energy to justify the expense.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Passive solar building design, how=
ever,
can significantly reduce heating costs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nb=
sp;
</span>Technological advances, including the incorporation of photovoltaic
components in roofing and building materials, should make solar power a more
viable source of electricity in the near future.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>9.4
<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Conservation<o:p>=
</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
state&#8217;s energy conservation efforts since 1990 have focused on
&#8220;Demand Side Management&#8221; (DSM) to increase energy efficiency,
reduce energy demand, and in effect increase available energy supplies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In 1990, under order of the Public
Service Board, electric utilities were required to develop a variety of dem=
and
side management programs for their customers, which have since been
consolidated into one statewide energy efficiency utility &#8211; Efficiency
Vermont.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In recent years the =
state
also passed energy standards for commercial and residential construction, w=
hich
are administered and enforced through the Department of Labor and
Industry.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Net-metering to enc=
ourage
the use of more decentralized, renewable energy resources went into effect =
in
1998, and legislation is now pending to promote greater energy efficiency a=
nd
renewables through the use of tax credits and other state support
programs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Legislation is also
currently being considered that would establish minimum statewide outdoor
lighting standards.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
need for increased energy efficiency and conservation, in part to reduce en=
ergy
costs, is also recognized locally &#8211; particularly for Northfield&#8217=
;s
older, historic homes and public buildings.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>For example, the Gray Building Coa=
lition
is seeing that the building is energy efficient.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A number of programs are available=
 to
local residents and businesses to increase energy efficiencies and reduce
costs.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Efficiency
Vermont<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Efficiency
Vermont, created by the Public Service Board in 1999, consolidates the ener=
gy
conservation programs offered by individual utilities into one statewide en=
ergy
efficiency utility &#8211; a first in the nation.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Vermont&#8217;s &#8220;Invisible P=
ower
Plant&#8221; to date has saved the equivalent of 11.8 MW during the peak wi=
nter
period, and 6.2 MW at summer peak<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nb=
sp;
</span>Its efficiency programs are financed by the state&#8217;s electric
utilities through an &#8220;energy efficiency charge&#8221; that is passed =
on
to ratepayers (2.372% to Northfield customers and 2.095% to CVPS customers =
in
2002).<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Current programs avail=
able
to Vermont residents, businesses, and municipalities, include:<o:p></o:p></=
span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<ul style=3D'margin-top:0in' type=3Ddisc>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l10 level1 lfo49;tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight=
:normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Efficient Products</span></b><=
span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> &#8211; provides energy effic=
ient
     product information and discount coupons.<o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l10 level1 lfo49;tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight=
:normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Vermont Energy Star &reg; Homes
     Program</span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1=
0.0pt;
     font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> &#8211;
     provides technical assistance and rebates to homebuilders and buyers w=
ho
     build energy efficient homes.<o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l10 level1 lfo49;tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight=
:normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Commercial Energy Opportunitie=
s</span></b><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> &#8211; provides technical and
     financial assistance to commercial and industrial businesses to improve
     the efficiency of existing and new facilities.<o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l10 level1 lfo49;tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight=
:normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Dairy Farm Program</span></b><=
span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> &#8211; provides technical as=
sistance,
     financial incentives, and low-interest financing for energy efficient =
farm
     equipment.<o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l10 level1 lfo49;tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight=
:normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Residential Energy Efficiency
     Program (REEP) </span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
     10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&#821=
1;
     provides technical and financial assistance to developers, owners and
     managers of low income multi-family housing to reduce energy costs <o:=
p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-bottom:3.0pt;text-align:justify;mso-=
list:
     l10 level1 lfo49;tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight=
:normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Income</span></b><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>-<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-wei=
ght:
     normal'>Eligible Services</b> &#8211; provides technical and financial
     assistance to low-income Vermonters who are participating in the
     state&#8217;s weatherization program to make additional electricity-sa=
ving
     improvements.<o:p></o:p></span></li>
 <li class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;mso-list:l10 level1 lfo4=
9;
     tab-stops:list .5in'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
     style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
     mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Emerging Market Initiatives
     Program &#8211; </span></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-size:
     10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>ident=
ifies,
     evaluates and tests innovating energy efficiency technologies, and
     practices to promote their use. <o:p></o:p></span></li>
</ul>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times =
New Roman";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-=
language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></u></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Transportation<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Few
alternatives currently exist that would allow Northfield residents to become
less dependent on automobiles for transportation.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Nevertheless, as gasoline prices c=
limb
and vehicle emissions continue to erode air quality, reasonable efforts sho=
uld
be made to promote ridesharing, alternative modes of transportation, and le=
ss
auto-oriented patterns of development.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbs=
p;
</span>The Central Vermont Transportation Authority provides information on
carpooling, ridesharing, vanpooling, and special public transportation need=
s.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Local
initiatives that could help reduce the number of vehicle miles traveled inc=
lude
the completion of the proposed bicycle and recreation path between Northfie=
ld
Falls and Northfield Village, and the development of a local park and ride
facility.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield could al=
so
take advantage of municipal programs offered through EVermont, a nonprofit
affiliated with the Agency of Natural Resources, which advocates for the us=
e of
cleaner, more energy efficient alternative fuel vehicles (AFVs).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>AFVs include vehicles powered by
electricity, compressed natural gas, propane, and biodiesel fuels.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>EVermont, in association with the =
Agency
of Transportation, currently offers electric vehicle (EV) leasing programs =
to
municipalities, businesses, and institutions.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is also involved in testing a v=
ariety
of alternative fuel technologies for use in Vermont.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Land
Use &amp; Development Patterns</span></u></b><span style=3D'font-family:Ari=
al;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>As
shown by the number of local residents who walk to work in Northfield Villa=
ge,
concentrated development can reduce reliance on the automobile, vehicle mil=
es
traveled, and inherent system energy costs &#8211; including energy costs
associated with maintaining roads and related infrastructure.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Clustering development in the vici=
nity
of existing development and infrastructure, including roads and power lines,
generally disturbs less land, and requires less energy to construct and
maintain.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Sidewalks and conne=
cting
paths encourage people to walk, rather than drive, to destinations within a
quarter to a half-mile of where they live. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>At
the site level, a southern building orientation and landscaping can effecti=
vely
reduce energy demand.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Cluster=
ing,
and other energy efficient development patterns can be encouraged, and/or
required through local zoning and subdivision regulations.<o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Buildings &amp; Equipment<o:p=
></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>In
addition to the adoption of energy codes for residential, commercial, and p=
ublic
buildings, there are a number of other programs offered by the state to pro=
mote
municipal energy efficiency and the use of renewable energy resources.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These include but are not limited =
to the
various programs offered through Efficiency Vermont, EVermont electric vehi=
cle
leases, the School Energy Management Program (SEMP) targeted to school
administrators, and programs to support the conversion of school heating
systems to wood-burning systems.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </s=
pan><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Municipal
energy savings can be realized through regular energy audits of municipal
buildings and the use of &#8220;life cycle costing&#8221; practices that
incorporate long-term energy savings in the fiscal analysis of facility
construction and equipment purchases.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Such costing methods often demonstrate that long-term energy savings
more than offset the higher initial purchase or construction cost of energy
efficient equipment and building improvements.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:no=
rmal'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:
EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:l=
ine'><br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span></i></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>9.5<span
style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Assistance Progra=
ms<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Rising
energy costs for heat, electricity, and transportation are particularly har=
d on
low-income households who can least afford them.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Programs administered through the
Central Vermont Community Action Council, which are specifically targeted to
help income-eligible residents, include seasonal and emergency fuel assista=
nce,
supported in part through the WARMTH donations collected by private utiliti=
es,
and free weatherization services to help reduce heating costs.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Northfield can assist such program=
s by
providing program information locally, and by continuing to support Communi=
ty
Action.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Limited emergency fuel
assistance is also available locally through Community Emergency Relief
Volunteers (CERV), which at present receives no municipal funding. <o:p></o=
:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-inden=
t:0in;
mso-list:l36 level2 lfo50;tab-stops:list .25in'><![if !supportLists]><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>9.6<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times =
New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nb=
sp;
</span></span></span></i></b><![endif]><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:nor=
mal'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bi=
di-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span

mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Energy
Goals, Policies &amp; Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span

idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Goal<o:p=
></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<div style=3D'mso-element:para-border-div;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText3 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-si=
ze:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
availability of affordable energy supplies to meet the needs of current and
future Northfield residents in a manner that maximizes energy conservation,
maximizes the use of renewable resources, and reinforces traditional land u=
se
patterns and municipal development policies. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-family:=
Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Policies</span></i></b><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o=
:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
mso-list:l18 level1 lfo51;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span

ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The availa=
bility
of electric energy at reasonable cost to local customers through active
involvement in the state&#8217;s formulation of electric utility policy will
continue to be ensured, to the extent of the municipalities&#8217; abilitie=
s.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

mso-list:l18 level1 lfo51;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span

ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=
p;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Energy
efficiency and conservation will be a primary consideration in new municipal
construction projects, equipment purchases, and operations.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Life cycle costing shall be used b=
y the
town in evaluating energy-related capital expenditures as appropriate.<o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=
p;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Programs to
assist low-income residents in meeting or reducing energy costs, including
weatherization, rehabilitation, and affordable supply programs, will by
supported by the town in relation to local need.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=

<span

;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Reliance on
single-occupant vehicles should be reduced through:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom=

g,
and improving, the local transit program (see Chapter 7);<o:p></o:p></span>=
</p>

to the Exit 5 Park &amp; Ride Facility in Williamstown and the creation of a
municipal commuter parking facility in or near the Village (see Chapter 7);=
 and
<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:1.0in;text-align:justify;text-ind=

pedestrian opportunities, including the construction of the Memorial
Park-Northfield Falls bike/pedestrian path and the Dog River path connecting
the Village with Norwich University.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The locati=
on
of renewable energy generation facilities in the community should be allowe=
d after
the community has developed standards to ensure such facilities will have
minimal adverse impact to wildlife populations and water quality; will miti=
gate
to the extent possible aesthetic impacts; will not cause a nuisance to the
surrounding area (e.g., due to excessive noise) and will not result in undue
risk to public health and safety (e.g., through a lack of security or
uncontrolled access).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";

</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
mso-list:l18 level1 lfo51;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span

ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>An adequate
land base will be maintained for sustainable forest management through
continued stewardship of public forest land, support for current use tax
abatement programs for managed woodland, and land use regulations which
discourage the fragmentation of large tracts of productive forest. <o:p></o=
:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b><i><span style=3D'font=

Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Tasks<o:p></o:p></span></i></=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=

normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=

 none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=

an
energy audit of existing buildings, and street light fixtures, to determine
whether cost savings could be realized through greater efficiencies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>[Staff]<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Review and
update as needed existing town policies, bylaws and ordinances to promote e=
nergy
efficiency and conservation; to protect renewable energy resources and acce=
ss
for their sustainable use; and to support settlement patterns and site desi=
gns
that minimize energy consumption.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>[Planning Commission]<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

 Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
mso-list:l40 level1 lfo53;tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><![if !s=
upportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>3)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=
p;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Develop
criteria and standards for the development of wind-energy facilities.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>[Planning Commission]<o:p></o:p></=
span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
mso-list:l40 level1 lfo53;tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><![if !s=
upportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>4)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=
p;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Include an
assessment of energy efficiency to determine eligibility for weatherization
programs in the local housing survey (see Chapter 5).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.5in;
mso-list:l40 level1 lfo53;tab-stops:.5in center 3.0in right 6.0in'><![if !s=
upportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>5)<span style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times N=
ew Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbs=
p;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Evaluate l=
ocal
knowledge of, and access to, Efficiency Vermont programs to determine if lo=
cal
electric customers could make greater use of available programs.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>[Electric Department]<o:p></o:p></=
span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
font-variant:small-caps;text-transform:uppercase;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><=
br
clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoTitle><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0=
pt;
text-transform:uppercase'>Chapter 10.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Land Use</span><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10=
.0pt;
text-transform:uppercase;font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>10.1
<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp; </span>Overview<o:p></o:p></span></i=
></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Historically,
land use and development patterns were largely influenced by dominant
transportation networks and economic systems.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As Northfield&#8217;s economic bas=
e has
changed, and transportation networks have become more dispersed, land use
patterns have become less dependent upon these factors.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>To
address modern development pressures in a manner that protects the health a=
nd
safety of local residents and promotes community interests, such as maintai=
ning
a healthy environment and a vibrant economy &#8211; the Town and Village ha=
ve
enacted rules and regulations to guide land use and development.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A principal purpose of the municip=
al
plan is to provide the foundation for those regulations, and to identify ot=
her
policies and actions that can be taken to support the future land use plan.=
<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This is especially important today=
, as
the Town and Village appear to be poised for a period of renewed growth and=
 new
development.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>10.2
<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp; </span>Settlement Patterns<o:p></o:p=
></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><u><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p><span style=3D'text-deco=
ration:
 none'>&nbsp;</span></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Although
significant changes have occurred over the past 100+ years, a citizen of 19=
<sup>th</sup>
century Northfield would likely recognize the community today. <span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span>The historic settlement pattern &#8=
211;
characterized by four village centers built adjacent to power and
transportation networks, and surrounded by rural countryside, including
scattered homesteads in more accessible stream valleys and limited or no
development in rugged, inaccessible upland areas &#8211; remains largely in=
tact
today.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The significant featur=
es of
that historic pattern are briefly described below.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b><u><span style=3D'font=
-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Village Centers<o:p></o:p></s=
pan></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Although
linear, automobile-oriented development along the Route 12 corridor has blu=
rred
the boundaries of Northfield&#8217;s historic village centers.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The four villages are distinct in
character and function, and, in combination, continue to serve as the civic,
commercial, cultural, industrial, and residential centers of the
community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span>=
</p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Beginning
to the north, along the Berlin Boundary, <b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:n=
ormal'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Northfield Falls</i></b> retains much =
of its
historic character.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>With the
exception of a handful of small commercial businesses located along Route 1=
2,
the &#8220;Falls&#8221; is a predominately residential neighborhood.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The boundaries of Northfield Falls=
 are
fairly well defined.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The rura=
l Dog
River Valley stretches north toward Riverton.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A rugged, ledgey terrain and the D=
og
River form a physical and visual break from Northfield Village to the south;
and steeper terrain, and three covered bridges, forms a clear boundary to t=
he
east and west.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></s=
pan></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield</span></i></b><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bi=
di-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'> <b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Village</b></span></i><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'> is the main hub of the community.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Centered around Depot Square, Nort=
hfield
Village functions as the community&#8217;s downtown and the site of histori=
c residential
neighborhoods.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The incorporat=
ed
boundaries of the Village stretch well beyond the downtown and surrounding
neighborhoods, encompassing nearly a mile of the Route 12 corridor to the n=
orth
of the Square, encompassing the community&#8217;s principal industrial areas
and scattered commercial establishments. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:no=
rmal'>Center
Village</i></b>, home to Norwich University, may at first appear to a motor=
ist
heading south on Route 12 as an extension of Northfield Village.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The physical presence of the Unive=
rsity,
however, sets this area apart from that Village.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>With over 1,000 students living
on-campus, coupled with surrounding houses and apartment buildings, the
population of Center Village may nearly equal that of Northfield Village wh=
ile
school is in session.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The lan=
d use
pattern of Center Village is as much created by the campus setting, with
buildings oriented more toward, and relating to one another, and to formal =
open
space (e.g., quads, parade grounds), than to the street as is the case in
Northfield Village. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:11=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
color:black'>South Village</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
color:black'>, centered around the Interstate 89 access road, is the least
developed, and least defined, historic center.</span><span style=3D'font-si=
ze:
11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:n=
ormal'><i
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><s><o:p></o:p></s></i></b></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in center 3.0i=
n right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
four villages have all served as historic centers for community growth.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>They also are well suited to serve=
 as
the focus of much of the growth and development anticipated in future years,
particularly Northfield Village and the Norwich University Campus in Center
Village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></=
p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h4 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-=
font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Rural Areas <o:p></o:p></span></h4>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Historic
development in Northfield&#8217;s rural areas outside of the four villages =
has
primarily consisted of single-family dwellings associated with agriculture =
and
resource-based commercial activities (e.g., sawmills, gravel extraction).<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Most of this activity occurred in =
the
small valleys formed by major tributaries to the Dog River, including Cox, =
Union,
Stony, and Felchner Brooks, and on the most level land in upland areas.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Agriculture has declined in Northf=
ield
to the point where no commercial farming operations are presently in operat=
ion.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Large areas of farmland remain ope=
n,
however, as residents maintain horses or other livestock for personal use, =
or
keep the land open for aesthetic purposes.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>=
&nbsp;
</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>With
the decline of agriculture &#8211; and the decline of the steam engine and =
its
thirst for fuel wood &#8211; came the return of the forest.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Forests now cover the vast majorit=
y of
the total acreage of the town, covering nearly all of the steep hillsides a=
nd
mountainous land in the Northfield Range and on Turkey Hill and Paine
Mountain.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Despite all other c=
hanges
the Town has experienced, the return of the forest may well be the greatest
land use change of the past century. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<h5 style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-f=
ont-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Current La=
nd
Use<o:p></o:p></span></h5>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Forest
land &#8211; whether actively managed for timber production or large tracts=
 of
wooded land associated with rural-residential uses &#8211; is by far the
dominant land use in the community, encompassing nearly 87% of the total la=
nd
area of the Town.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
color:black'>Agricultural and open land is the second most common land use
&#8211; in terms of total acreage.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Although there currently are no working dairy farms, other commercial
agricultural enterprises presently exist in Northfield, including but not
limited to vegetable, flower, and goat farms.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Open land associated with resident=
ial
uses continues to contribute to the rural character and scenic beauty of ma=
ny
of Northfield&#8217;s backroads and rural neighborhoods.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This sentiment is apparently share=
d by
many local landowners who are responsible for keeping the land open.<o:p></=
o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

      <td width=3D189 valign=3Dtop style=3D'width:141.95pt;border:solid bla=
