gin"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=3D293 height=3D369
src=3D"TownPlan_files/image043.gif" align=3Dleft hspace=3D12 vspace=3D10
alt=3D"Text Box: Table 10.1&#13;&#10;Northfield Current Land Use&#13;&#10;L=
and Use Category	Total Acres&#13;&#10;Agriculture/Open Land	3,701.2&#13;&#1=
0;Cemetery	24.9&#13;&#10;Commercial/Service	45.3&#13;&#10;Forest Land	37,33=
1.0&#13;&#10;Industrial	70.3&#13;&#10;Government/Institutional 	10.8&#13;&#=
10;Outdoor Recreation	215.6&#13;&#10;Residential	695.5&#13;&#10;Roads/Pavem=
ent	10.5&#13;&#10;Quarries/Gravel Pits	12.1&#13;&#10;Schools	108.5&#13;&#10=
;Scrub/Shrub	605.8&#13;&#10;Surface Waters	94.7&#13;&#10;Wetlands	23.5&#13;=
&#10;Barren/Other	9.8&#13;&#10;Source: Central VT Regional Planning Commiss=
ion&#13;&#10;&#13;&#10;"
v:shapes=3D"_x0000_s2075"><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bid=
i-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The domina=
nt
land use in terms of total parcels is for residential purposes.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Much of Northfield&#8217;s residen=
tial
development is concentrated in village neighborhoods &#8211; especially in
Northfield Village and Northfield Falls (see Chapter 5).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In recent years, however, the majo=
rity
of the new residential development has occurred outside of the traditional
centers.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Primarily consisting=
 of
single-family homes on large (relative to village) lots, most residential
development is expected to continue to occur in areas outside of the villag=
es
unless additional opportunities for village scale development, such as
including in-fill development and redevelopment of village sites, can be
facilitated.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Industrial
development encompasses 70 acres, although additional vacant land has been
identified for industrial development and is presently served by municipal
facilities.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Most industrial s=
ites
are located in Northfield Village, primarily the Nantanna Mill, Bean Indust=
rial
Park, and railroad property west of the downtown.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Commercial
land uses are largely found in the downtown and north of the downtown in a
low-density linear pattern along Route 12 and, to a limited extent in
Northfield Falls.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Other scatt=
ered
commercial activities are located in town, including at the Intersection of
Route 12 and Lovers Lane.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </sp=
an><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Educational
uses include the Northfield schools and Norwich University campus, while mo=
st
other governmental and institutional uses are located in Northfield
Village.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>An estimate of curre=
nt
land use, by general category, is contained in Table 10.1. <o:p></o:p></spa=
n></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>10.3<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
Current
Land Use Regulation<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The Town and Village have been actively guiding land use=
 and
development in the community for several decades through the use of develop=
ment
regulations.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The current zoni=
ng
regulations, adopted in 1986 and subsequently revised, are generally design=
ed
to reinforce Northfield&#8217;s historic settlement pattern of an urban core
along the Dog River/Route 12 corridor north from the Berlin Town boundary s=
outh
to the area surrounding intersections of Route 12 and Route 12A, and Route =
12
and Route 64.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This core area
encompasses each of the four historic villages.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Outside of the urban core, land is generally designated =
for
moderate to low-density residential uses and such land-based uses as
agriculture, forestry, and outdoor recreation.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Two limited commercial areas are a=
lso
located outside of the urban core, although neither is served by municipal
water or sewer.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A brief descr=
iption
of current land use districts is provided in Table 10.2.<o:p></o:p></span><=
/p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'mso-special-character:line-=
break;
page-break-before:always'>

  style=3D'font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times N=
ew Roman"'>To
  provide for an area capable of accommodating concentrated commercial and
  industrial uses related to the area&#8217;s proximity to I-89.<o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

  acre<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Time=
s New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-farea=
st-language:
EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall
style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><b><u><sp=
an
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Developm=
ent
Standards<o:p></o:p></span></u></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Northfield&#8217;s
current zoning regulations regulate the types of uses that are allowed in v=
arious
zoning districts, the densities in which they are allowed (expressed as the
number of units/principal uses per acre), and the dimensional standards wit=
hin
each district (e.g., minimum setbacks, maximum height).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Few regulations regarding the over=
all
pattern of development, or to achieve other district purposes are included
(e.g., maintain agricultural land, avoid development of steep slopes).<o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
Town also does not presently regulate land subdivision.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As the community grows &#8211;
especially as more residential development occurs in the rural residential,
secondary agriculture and conservation and forestry districts &#8211;
regulating land subdivision could help to achieve many of those district
purposes while ensuring the orderly layout of new development and coordinat=
ed
extension of facilities and roads.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; <=
/span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Within
the urban core, site development standards could address how new buildings =
and
associated improvements (e.g., lighting, parking, sidewalks) relate with the
surrounding area, enhance streetscapes, and contribute to the pedestrian-sc=
ale,
urban fabric of the community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </spa=
n>This
is especially important as in-fill development and redevelopment occurs in =
and
around the downtown and along the Route 12 corridor. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>Options
for improving Northfield&#8217;s land use and development regulations to
achieve the assorted policies of this plan, including those related to econ=
omic
development, housing, transportation,<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>and the protection of natural and cultural features, are described in
the following section.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=
11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=
-weight:
normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>10.4
<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp; </span>Future Land Use</span></i></b=
><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeading9 style=3D'margin-right:0in;text-align:justify;tab-sto=
ps:-.5in .75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in 1.75in 2.0in 2.25in 2.5in 2.75in 3.0in 3.=
25in 3.5in 3.75in 4.0in 4.25in 4.5in 4.75in 5.0in 5.25in 5.5in 5.75in'><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>&#8220;U=
rban
Core&#8221; Growth Center<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-siz=
e:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Northfield&#8217;s historic
settlement pattern of compact villages surrounded by rural countryside has
served the community well for nearly 220 years and should continue to suppo=
rt a
vital and diverse community.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Although concentrating development in village, or &#8220;growth,&#82=
21;
centers is not as important for economic and transportation purposes as it =
once
was, supporting growth centers is good public policy in that it:<o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-right:.5pt;text-align:justify;tab-stop=
s:0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.7pt;margin-botto=
m:3.0pt;
margin-left:37.4pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18.7pt;mso-list:l31 leve=
l1 lfo54;
tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&#8226;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Is cost-ef=
fective
by limiting expensive facility extensions into un-served areas,<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.7pt;margin-botto=
m:3.0pt;
margin-left:37.4pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18.7pt;mso-list:l31 leve=
l1 lfo54;
tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>&#8226;<span
style=3D'font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;=
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Maintains =
the
community&#8217;s historic character,<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.7pt;margin-botto=
m:3.0pt;

t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Is an
efficient use of land and resources,<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.7pt;margin-botto=
m:3.0pt;
margin-left:37.4pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18.7pt;mso-list:l33 leve=

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Promotes
transportation alternatives, thereby conserving energy and ensuring that al=
l citizens
have access to services and employment,<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.7pt;margin-botto=
m:3.0pt;
margin-left:37.4pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18.7pt;mso-list:l33 leve=

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:

economic vitality, and<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.5pt;margin-botto=
m:0in;

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Avoids soc=
ial
isolation and fosters a healthy, safe community.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.5pt;margin-botto=
m:0in;
margin-left:3.0pt;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;tab-stops:0in'><=

"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBlockText style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-si=
ze:11.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'>The
urban core as presently defined should continue to accommodate a majority of
the community&#8217;s residential growth and nearly all of its commercial a=
nd
industrial growth.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Existing l=
and
use regulations could, however, better achieve this objective &#8211; and
strengthen existing settlement patterns &#8211; through the following:<o:p>=
</o:p></span></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.5pt;margin-botto=
m:0in;
margin-left:.5in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25i=
n;
mso-list:l54 level1 lfo56;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span

"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black=
'>Designation
of a central business district, including but not necessarily limited to the
historic downtown around Depot Square and adjacent land.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Such a district could correspond t=
o a
designated downtown district (see Chapter 6), and should include dimensional
and other site design standards that reflect existing patterns.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Current setbacks, building coverag=
e and
on-site parking requirements discourage a high density of development and
likely cause many important buildings that contribute to the character of t=
he
downtown to be non-conforming.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.5pt;margin-botto=
m:0in;

"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-top:0in;margin-right:.5pt;margin-botto=

provide a reasonable incentive to applicants to seek application, and will
allow for attractive, high quality master-planned development in appropriate
areas.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Consideration should a=
lso be
given to developing specific PUD standards to address different development=

(e.g., university campus, industrial park, downtown development).<o:p></o:p=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span

"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeading9 style=3D'margin-right:0in;text-align:justify;tab-sto=
ps:-.5in .75in 1.0in 1.25in 1.5in 1.75in 2.0in 2.25in 2.5in 2.75in 3.0in 3.=
25in 3.5in 3.75in 4.0in 4.25in 4.5in 4.75in 5.0in 5.25in 5.5in 5.75in'><span
style=3D'font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Rural
Character<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-.5in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Land use and development is currently regulated with the
intent to maintain the rural character of the countryside that surrounds
&#8211; and stands in contrast to &#8211; the village centers.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>As the community grows, it is
anticipated that much of the pressure for residential development will focu=
s on
these areas due to the availability of land, transportation technology that
allows access to remote locations (e.g., prevalence of four-wheel drive
vehicles), and a desire of many homebuyers for a rural lifestyle.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Methods to achieve this goal while
accommodating anticipated residential development include:<o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in;
mso-list:l29 level1 lfo57;tab-stops:list .5in'><![if !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><span style=3D'mso-lis=
t:Ignore'>&#8226;<span

&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Review the
effectiveness of the secondary agriculture district.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>While established to maintain
agricultural land, the only significant difference from the rural residenti=
al
district is density (the rural residential district allows 3 acre lots with=
in
&frac14; mile of town roads, compared with a 5 acre minimum lot size in the
secondary agriculture district).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=
nt:-.25in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=

the
Conservation and Forestry District to determine whether additional standards
are needed to achieve the purpose of the district, including standards to
address development on steep slopes and associated erosion and runoff.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

in
addition, or as an alternative to, the options described above) the adoptio=

subdivision regulations to guide emerging settlement patterns in a way that

hat
development patterns, infrastructure and roads are extended in an orderly,

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;

industrial and commercial districts and consider whether uses allowed within

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-inde=

Unit Development (PUD) provisions and consider whether they adequately addr=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=

<div style=3D'mso-element:para-border-div;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;

<p class=3DMsoBodyText2 style=3D'text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-=
alt:
solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:1.0pt 4.0pt 1.0pt 4.0pt'>=
<span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>To maintain the Town a=
nd
Village&#8217;s historic settlement pattern while managing development in a
manner to further the other goals and policies of this Plan.<o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:.5in center 3.0i=

"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><b style=3D'mso-bidi-font=

<span

ck'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify'><span style=3D'font-size:=

mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:18.75pt;text-align:justif=
y;

areast-font-family:
Arial;color:black'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>1)<span style=3D'font:7.=
0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black=
'>Development
will be encouraged, through land use regulations and related policies of th=
is
Plan, to locate within the urban core, defined as the land use districts
identified in Table 10.2 and depicted on the Land Use Districts Map (which
comprises this Plan&#8217;s future land use map), and to accommodate land u=
ses
outside this core in a manner that maintains those areas&#8217; natural
resources and rural character.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;
text-indent:0in;tab-stops:.5in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black=
'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:18.75pt;text-align:justif=
y;
text-indent:-18.75pt;mso-list:l6 level1 lfo58;tab-stops:list 18.75pt'><![if=
 !supportLists]><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=
areast-font-family:
Arial;color:black'><span style=3D'mso-list:Ignore'>2)<span style=3D'font:7.=
0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black=
'>Infrastructure
and transportation improvements will be coordinated with land use polices to
ensure that growth and development occurs at a rate and scale that does not
overburden community facilities or services or undermine the community&#821=
7;s
historic character.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;
text-indent:0in;tab-stops:.5in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fo=

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black=
'>Northfield
Village&#8217;s role as the cultural, civic, and industrial center for the
community should continue to be supported.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>=
&nbsp;
</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;
text-indent:0in;tab-stops:.5in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fo=

'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:18.75pt;text-align:justif=
y;

0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fon=
t-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black=
'>Development
in traditional village settings should be designed to reflect the tradition=
al,
pedestrian-scale of development, maintain an aesthetic streetscape, and
contribute to the historic character and pattern of development.<o:p></o:p>=
</span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;
text-indent:0in;tab-stops:.5in'><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-fo=

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:18.75pt;text-align:justif=

'>The
downtown area&#8217;s central commercial, civic and cultural community func=
tion
will be reinforced through a concentrated mix of land uses at high densities
and an urban pattern of development.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;

vitality of Norwich University should be supported in a manner that enhances

<p class=3DMsoBodyTextIndent style=3D'margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;

should be maintained while accommodating compatible commercial uses that do=

<p class=3DMsoNormal align=3Dcenter style=3D'text-align:center'><b style=3D=
'mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-fami=
ly:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";text-transform:uppercase'>Chap=
ter
11.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Implementation</span></b>=
<b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style=3D'font-size:16.0pt;mso-b=
idi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p=
></span></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan

"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=

"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>11.1 <span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp; </span>Overv=
iew<o:p></o:p></span></i></b></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Community change is the result of countless individual a=
nd
collective decisions and actions of citizens, businesses, and public
officials.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>When those decisio=
ns and
actions are based on a shared vision of the future, a community can achieve
that vision.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Previous chapter=
s of
this plan set forth the planning background, and the goals for each plan
element which, taken together, constitute a vision for Northfield&#8217;s
future.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Achieving those goals=
 will
require the cooperation of many people and public and private agencies, usi=
ng a
variety of mechanisms over the next five, ten and twenty years.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>This section briefly describes the
different tools and programs available to implement the plan.<o:p></o:p></s=
pan></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>11.2<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
Plan
Adoption</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1=
0.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Adoption by the Northfield Boards of Town Selectmen and
Village Trustees, pursuant to the procedures established in 24 V.S.A. Chapt=
er
117 </span><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-f=
amily:
Arial'>&sect;</span><span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0=
pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>4384 and </span><=
span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>&sec=
t;</span><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>4385, is the first step in putting the plan into
action.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Through adoption, the
Selectmen and Trustees accept this document as the guide for future physica=
l growth
and change in the Town and Village.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>11.3<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
Central
Vermont Regional Planning Commission (CVRPC) Approval</span></i></b><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Approval by the CVRPC allows for greater regional planni=
ng
and cooperation among towns in addressing mutual problems and challenges,
maintains the Town and Village&#8217;s eligibility for municipal planning f=
unds
as well as its authority to enact certain programs (e.g., impact fees).<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Once the plan is approved by the T=
own
Selectmen and Village Trustees, it should be submitted to CVRPC for regional
approval.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>11.4<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
Ongoing
Planning</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1=
0.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Ongoing planning is one of the most important elements of
the process of keeping a town plan up to date and relevant.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Planning Commission, Selectmen,
Trustees and Town and Village Staff should use the plan on an ongoing basis=
 to
ensure that its goals and policies are integrated in day-to-day decisions
concerning public facilities and services, transportation, land use, and
development in the town.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in 0in=
'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The Planning Commission is responsible for maintaining a=
nd
amending the plan. <span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span>As conditi=
ons
change and new information becomes available, amendments may be needed to k=
eep
the plan current.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Special stu=
dies,
public forums to consider specific issues, and regular meetings between loc=
al
boards are effective ways to sustain an ongoing planning process.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The plan automatically expires five
years from adoption.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Before t=
he
Plan expires, it should be thoroughly reviewed, and information on which the
plan is based should be updated.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<b style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:no=
rmal'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-f=

</span></i></b>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><b

ze:
14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Ti=
mes New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>This plan should serve as the blueprint and policy guide=
 for
future revisions to the Northfield Zoning Regulations.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Several suggestions for revisions,=
 or
for additional study, were described in various chapters of the plan, most
importantly Chapter 10<i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>. </i><span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span>In addition to consideration of rev=
isions
to the current zoning regulations, it is recommended in Chapter 10 that
consideration be given to adopting subdivision regulations.<o:p></o:p></spa=
n></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><b

l'><span

"Times New Roman"'>11.6<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
Other
Municipal Policies &amp; Programs</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:14=
.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New=
 Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Local land use regulations are not the only means with w=
hich
Northfield can implement various sections of this plan.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Other ordinances and policies can =
also
serve to carry out policies and strategies described in previous chapters.<=
span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>For example, the municipal sewer
allocation policy and local road policies were both identified as important
tools to implement various policies of the Plan.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Throughout the plan are several sp=
ecific
references to appropriate local implementation policies, as well as guidanc=
e to
regional organizations and state agencies as to how their programs can best
meet local needs and ensure consistency with local policies.<o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoHeader style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in cen=
ter 3.0in right 6.0in'><span
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>11.7<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
State
Permit Procedures</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-fo=
nt-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Presently, any commercial development involving one or m=
ore
acres of land, and any residential development or subdivision resulting in =
the
creation of 6 or more dwelling units or lots, requires Act 250 approval.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Should the town enact subdivision
regulations, in addition to having zoning and a town plan in place, the thr=
eshold
triggering Act 250 review would increase to 10 acres and 10 dwelling units,
respectively.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></sp=
an></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>One of the 10 criteria that projects must meet to comply
with Act 250 is that the development be in conformance with the town plan.<=
span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>In the case of Northfield, conform=
ance
should be determined by whether the proposed development is consistent with
specific policies listed at the end of chapters 2-10.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>If a project is not consistent wit=
h a
specific policy, it should be determined to be not in conformance with the
plan.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Both the Planning Commission and Selectboard have party
status to participate in all Act 250 review processes.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Both bodies should monitor project
applications, which are reported to the town by the District 5 Environmental
Commission, and participate in those processes whenever appropriate.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Other state and federal regulatory
processes, for example Section 248 (related to public energy facilities) and
the National Environmental Protection Act (related to federally funded
projects) also provide opportunity for local participation and review again=
st
the policies set forth in this plan.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>11.8<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
Public
Spending</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:1=
0.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Like most small Vermont towns, Northfield has a limited
capacity to raise and spend tax dollars on local government initiatives.<sp=
an
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Spending decisions are among the m=
ost
important means with which municipal government can implement the plan.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Fortunately, the Town and Village =
have a
history of planning for major expenditures through the annual preparation o=
f a
capital improvement plan and program.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;
</span>Maintaining the capital budgeting process is fiscally responsible, a=
nd
is a requirement should the community choose to take advantage of certain l=
ocal
and state programs (e.g., downtown designation, impact fees).<o:p></o:p></s=
pan></p>

<span style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New R=
oman";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;
layout-grid-mode:line'><br clear=3Dall style=3D'page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>In addition, Northfield has proven adept at securing
assistance for specific projects through public and private grant sources.<=
span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The development of this plan, for
example, was funded through the Vermont Municipal Planning Grant Program.<s=
pan
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The Town has been quite successful
competing for a variety of VTrans assistance programs, and as this plan is
being completed the community is also finalizing a feasibility study of
possible uses of the Gray Building that was funded through a Vermont Commun=
ity
Development Grant.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Staying aw=
are of
grant programs as they become available, and being prepared to submit
applications that further the policies of this plan, should be a priority f=
or
all local boards.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Finally, capital projects and facilities are not the only
important consideration related to public spending.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>A key policy and task of this plan=
 is to
expand the local community and economic development capacity through the
creation of a position of Community Development Director.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Over the long term, it is anticipa=
ted
that such a position will be a good public investment in that a local person
and/or entity focused on promoting economic development in Northfield will =
reap
many positive benefits, including growth in the local grand list and job
base.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp;</span><o:p></o:p=
></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Finally, a key and significant policy and task of this p=
lan
is the creation of a position of Community Development Director.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>We urge that this be considered as
important as capital projects and facilities relative to public spending; g=
iven
such recent events as (1) the new National Guard Armory and its large influ=
x of
both short-term and long-term visitors and (2) the creation of the National
Center for the study of Counter-terrorism and Cyber-crime, with a projectio=
n of
approximately 200 new families to reside in Northfield and the surrounding
area.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>It is imperative that t=
he
municipality be pro-active.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>T=
hus,
the creation of this position will be a good public investment in that a lo=
cal
person and/or entity focused on the promotion of economic development in
Northfield will reap many positive benefits, including growth in the local
grand list and job base.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>Clea=
rly in
the final analysis this position will more than pay for itself.<o:p></o:p><=
/span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><b
style=3D'mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style=3D'mso-bidi-font-style:norma=
l'><span
style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>11.9<span style=3D'mso-tab-count:1'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>=
Implementation
Tasks</span></i></b><span style=3D'font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0=
pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span=
></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=3DMsoNormal style=3D'text-align:justify;tab-stops:-1.0in -.5in'><s=
pan
style=3D'font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-b=
idi-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Most of the tools summarized above are described in grea=
ter
detail elsewhere in the plan.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span=
>At the
end of each preceding chapter, implementation tasks list specific actions t=
hat
can be undertaken by one or more specified bodies.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>These form the basis of the Planni=
ng
Commission&#8217;s action plan in the coming years, and should be periodica=
lly
reviewed as a measure of the Commission&#8217;s success implementing the pl=
an.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

</div>

di-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'> It is important to note that census values, as reported=
 by
individuals, represent personal estimates that do not necessarily reflect
current sale prices or assessed values.<span style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nb=
sp;
</span>For Northfield, the median sale price in 2000 of a single family
dwelling on less than six acres (R1) was $93,000; and for a dwelling on more
than six acres (R2) $105,000, based on property transfer data.<span
style=3D'mso-spacerun:yes'>&nbsp; </span>The average assessed value for R1
property on the 2000 grand list was $78,869.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
